Blog.post: hmmmm

last night was insane. brian and i went to a bbq at has's house early in the day. has wasn't even there yet - so we hung out with his family & drank beer. they made so much food. i swear - i had never seen anyone deep fry a turkey before - but it was unbelievable! mmm. so tasty. haha anyway, after a long day of drinking - of course it ended in a night full of drama. brian and i ended up in some dumb fight because he got mad at some of his friends because he thinks they want to "bang" me. then, i got mad because i didn't feel like anyone did or said anything offensive - and i felt like i wasn't being given a chance to fend for myself. anyway - we're not mad anymore. the whole thing was dumb. and i think we both blew it out of proportion. lesigh. drinking is the devil.
hmmm

oh lord - what a day. i woke up at eight to get ready to go to work - and i've been throwing up ever since. i'm so fucking gross. hehe. anyway, i never went to work - and spent most of the day on the bathroom floor. it was lovely. sigh. i heard from my mom that it was beautiful outside today. that figures.

tonight is an agents of man show. w00t. i'm going (as long as it doesn't interfere with me watching smallville). hehe. today i am going to try to make a new banner. my human member - tony - has proved to me how horrid mine are. it's ok though i guess - since i have absolutely no idea what i'm doing. let's just hope that practice makes perfect. lesigh. i must do some work now. xoxo

last night the dinner plans i mentioned earler came through. frank made a kick ass dinner & we got to catch up a bit. it had been a long time since i'd seen him last, so of course armed with a few glasses of wine in me i asked a lot of questions that i'd been waiting a long time to hear the answers to. unfortunately they weren't ecactly the ones i was hoping to hear, but it was nice just the same. i'm glad we got that over with. closure is sweet.. anyhow, afterwards i met up with chris who was just getting off work. we went back to his house and watched some "fifth wheel" dating show. it was rediculous. it did make me realize how lucky i am though. no matter how bored i get with being alone, at least i can take comfort in knowing that i'm not as pathetic as the people i saw on that show. lol. ok, back to work.

i have a headache. work was long as usual. i got a huge account today, which was good - but my stress level is pretty insane. i think i need to have some fun or something. all work and no play is making jenna a very dull girl. hmm. i've been thinking too much. i should be used to being alone all the time by now, but i'm not. it's making me insane. i should call desiree tomorrow & see if she want to hang out this weekend. that would be fun. hopefully some dinner plans will come through too. they've een discussed, but certain people are hand to come by these days. it's unfortunate that these people always seem to be the ones i want to see the most. this entry probably makes no sense - but it's after 11 (way past my bedtime), and i've already had three glasses of wine. forgive me or something.

hmmm

i feel so liberated. i finally deleted my bme page and bought an air conditioner in the same day! this is lovely. not only can i update my site in a comfortable climate - but now i can say ANYTHING about ANYTHING in my updates! i really don't know why it took me so long to do this. I should have deleted it in september, when i really started having bad feelings about the site - but shit, closure is closure and it's always better later than never. SO anyway, i'm at work right now. i had a new assistant start yesterday, and she's working out well. Her name is Pam, and she really is a sweet girl. Work has been crazy lately - and i really haven't had as much time to update as i'd like.. but that's definately going to change soon. i do believe i have some neew hate-mails and fan art to add.. which i'm going to do now. also, my show section is suffering like whoa - so that will be my project for tonight. lesigh. if an idle mind is the devils playground, than i must be an angel.

alrighty, so - yesterday was my birthday. i'm twenty fucking three. and i feel old as hell. i worked all day - and it was a nightmare. my dad's partner claimed that he had given me an eighty eight thousand dollar check to send to an insurance company. i knew he didn't give it to me, but when we called the bank it turned out that the check had cleared. i had no idea where it could have gone, and the client who's policy it was supposed to pay for - was being cancelled for non receipt of premium. needless to say- both my boss and my client were ready to kill me. i was about two seconds from a nervous breakdown when julien called my office for the ten thousanth time that day, so i finally picked up. i explained quickly that i couldn't talk (both of the men were sitting right in front of me at the time) - and instead of a quick ok - he starts interrogating me about when i will be able to talk (in a pretty nasty tone i might add). i had no choice but to hang up on him. my boss was already five seconds from ringing my neck and i was five seconds from jumping out a window. well, anyway after a few more hours of hysteria - we found the money. it turned out that my new boss's wife had deposited it into my new company premium account - and had just forgot to pay the company. we overnighted a check to them - and the problem was solved. by then it was six and all i wanted to do was go home, so i did. at around nine thirty - desiree met up with me for some birthday drinks. we ran into some of my old college friends - and then took a drive over to AJ's house to visit. it was pretty fun, and it totally made my day seeing her. lesigh. i am really pissed off at julien, even though it isn't his fault because he didn't know what i was up against - but then again, with him there & me here - he never will know. and i'm fucking tired of the rude emails and one sided bullshit. i feel like i'm being penalized because i don't have time to sit around analyzing other people's actions and writing long winded emails about myself. i hate to say this - but only the word pretensious comes to mind when i think of him lately. he thinks that everything applies to him. everything. and it just doesn't. ughh. i suck. and luckily i'm too busy to care. anyway, i'm at work now - and i'm tired as hell. i hope today goes quickly. i really do. i need some time out like whoa.

not much to talk about. i've been spending 60% of my time working, 30% on the internet, and 10% sleeping for the last few weeks. bah.
hmmm

the last few days have been beyond entertaining. saturday desiree and i went into the village to see a comedy show at gotham comedy club. her brother's roomate was performing.. and he was hysterical. we drank a ton there - and talked to just about every comedian in the place. afterwards we took a cab uptown & ate at this really nice steak house that her brother works at. we racked up over a $120. bill there - and desiree got so shit faced that she fell off of the bar stool and landed smack on her face! it was pretty scray at the time.. because her eyes were rolling around - but now the whole thing is pretty funny. needless to say, her brother was pretty pissed off. haha. i grabbed the keys to his apartment & we walked over there. desiree must have puked on every block in manhattan by the time we got there. hehehe. anyway, we went to bed & took the train back to jersey sunday morning. armed with severe hangovers, we made it to her families brunch by 12. we were both looking a mess - but at least we showed up, lol. after brunch she came with me to my mom's house & we drank a few beers... haha. she was so tired - so i finally dropped her off at her place. after that i headed over to Olives to meet up with Kevin & Brian. it was a benefit. and yeah, i drank again. haha. i got home around 9pm sunday - and i don't remember much between then & now besides work & sleep. lesigh. ya think i should stop drinking? nahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh.

wow. i never really write in here anymore. that's not a good thing now, is it? hmm. well, things are finally changing (for the better). work, although still hectic, is becoming a little less stressful. thankfully, david hired this guy to work with me a few weeks ago. his name is frank, and i'm starting to think that he's my guardian angel. (you think i'm kidding, but ever since he joined us, good things have happened) it's really nice having a partner around here. i was getting so used to dpoing everything on my own, and it's such a relief just to have someone to discuss things with. i can't even begin to tell you..

well. well. well. i've wandered back again. i finally have something to say, for a change. im pissed off. that's right kids. jenna is mad. to clarify, i'm pissed off at the following: 1. myself 2. emotions in general 3. all men 4. him there you have it. i've managed to get my heart broken again. jeezus. how may fucking times do i have to go through this shit before i'll realize that men are dirt. for christs sake. i quit guys. do you all hear that? i fucking quit. you know, i've been in at leat 3 successful relationships with women. no major problems. great sex. amazing friendships. and always. always. i wander back to the cock. well, not anymore. never ever again dildos don't break hearts. the end.

work SUCKED today. it was a total nightmare. i thought i was going to throw up all over my desk. i am SO happy that i'm home now. plus, i got good news on the way home. Traci is coming to see me tomorrow! much drinking and laughing will be done as usual. i haven't seen her in almost two weeks, so i'm really excited. nothing else to say really. everything else on my mind is not for sharing.

finally. something nice to talk about. first thing being, today is friday. know what that means? i get to sleep late tomorrow. that's got to be one of my favorite things to do. as for last night, i had a really great time. after work i took my mom out for dinner at Caruso's, and had a few apple martini's and a delicious filet mignon with galrlic mashed potatos. mmmmm. it was so very good. afte dinner, i went to visit a new friend i hadn't seen in a while. we watched lord of the rings and stuff. i ended up getting so sleepy, that i stayed over - which i probably shouldn't have done. miraculously, i made it to work on time, and even had time to stop home to change & clean up. i thought for sure i was going to be late, but i wasn't. it's nice when things go right for a change. anyway, as for the weekend - i have no idea what i'm going to do. i guess someone will ask me to do something, and i'll do that. the only thing i really have on my agenda it to hit up the book store, because i'm fresh out of new material. oh yeah, i heard this song on the radio on the way into the office this morning. i know i never heard it before and i have no idea who sang it, but the chorus went something like this: "i don't know you, but im with you" i don't know, for some reason i just found the whole thing very ironic. anyway, it's time to make some money.

tonight was a really nice night, and well deserved at that. i feel the need to mention that smallville is the best show ever. that's all for now, i suppose. i'm really looking forward a little television and to a nice nights sleep.

last night i went to the blood for blood show at CBGB's with shamrock and wreak. it was a great show. afterwards, we went to manitobas and drank our butts off. it was fun, but not where i really wanted to be. as for today, I am sick as hell. or maybe just depressed. i don't even know. who cares. either way i feel like shit. bye.

"I want somebody who sees the pointlessness and still keeps their purpose in mind I want somebody who has a tortured soul some of the time I want somebody who will either put out for me or put me out of misery or maybe just put it all to words and make me say, you know I never heard it put that way make me say, what did you just say? I want somebody who can hold my interest hold it and never let it fall someone who can flatten me with a kiss that hits like a fist or a sentence, that stops me like a brick wall because if you hear me talking listen to what I'm not saying if you hear me playing guitar listen to what I'm not playing and don't ask me to put words to all the spaces between notes in fact if you have to ask, forget it do and you'll regret it I'm tired of being the interesting one I'm tired of heving fun for two just lay yourself on the line and I might lay myself down by you but don't sit behind your eyes and wait for me to surprise you I want somebody who can make me scream until it's funny give me a run for my money I want someone who can twist me up in knots tell me, for the woman who has everything what have you got? I want someone who's not afraid of me or anyone else in other words I want someone who's not afraid of themself do you think I'm asking too much?"

i am probably the most confused person on the planet today. really. i don't even know what to say or do.. have you ever had someone decide they don't ever want to talk to you again for no apparent reason? it's got to be the hardest thing to swallow right now.. or ever. i just don't get it. i really don't. i am such a fool for thinking he liked me.i am the biggest sucker on the planet. i really am. i just want to hide in my room and never speak to another human being for as long as i live.

"oh well" mode is kicking in. his loss. anyway, i'm going to the city now to meet up with Pat (my tattoo artist) and shamrock for some heavy drinking. fuck being sad. it's useless. plus, all things considered, a person with no heart is the least of my worries. bye kids.

another day, another dollar. meh. yesterday was eventful. my mom had to go to the hospital for some tests, because she's hemmoraiging. it's probably pollips that ruptured or something, and she's going to need surgery. she's going back to the doctor tomorrow for more tests and to make a date. obviously, my dad is really worried, and that's not the best thing for him to be doing in his condition. such is life, i suppose. in any event, my partner stopped by for a while last night to talk. he's not having such a great week. while he was there i ended up unpacking about 10 boxes of books, then did some laundry, cleaned out my closet, and made my bed all prety with new sheets. after he left, i just couldn't fall sleep, so i watched hbo until i had work this morning. now it turns out i have to run home on my lunchbreak & change so that i can go to a meeting in the bronx after work. after that, my attorney and i are grabbing some dinner & then i guess i'll be heading back to glorious new jersey. i wish this week was over already, i'm wiped.

i don't think i have ever been so fond of snow before. and i feel pretty damn good. the only thing that would make me happier, was if it was the weekend already. in any event, i wrote a new riff for every glass of wine i drank this evening. if this keeps up my fingers will be bleeding before nights end... what else? hmm. well, i made a yummy dinner tonight. garlic herb chicken and pasta, corn, celery and carrots in a light olive oil, lemon & butter sauce. too bad i ate less than a plate. haha i have no appetite usually, so why do i bother cooking? somone please tell me. oh well, i guess it's time to drink more. there is just nothing else to do. maybe i'll actually finish an entire song for a change. sigh.
ok. ok .ok. i was wrong. not all guys are garbage. and although i hate valentines day, i had an incredibe time. i really did.

Welcome to the rest of my life. I'm alive again. I feel like I just lifted my head out of a cloud of dust... I perceive everything more clearly. People, music, emotions, subtleties.... My eyes are different. I'm just at peace with things right now. They're not hard. And that was what I wanted. I'm making sense of it all. For the first time in a really long time, I am not attached to any person, or to the idea of any person. And now I get to exist and think and make decisions entirely on the basis of me. And I think that is really important to do, particularly when I am trying to figure out the direction I want my life to head in. This is healthy. And if I spend time in this place and find out I'm heading in the same direction I always thought i wanted to be in, then all the better. Because then I would be at peace with it, knowing I made the choices that were best for me, not just for someone else. Life is starting to get real and I am putting my head on straight. I am not afraid. Que sera sera.

voices on the answering machine. ghosts. leading a double life. again. the disparity between my words and my actions. my mouth and my hands. my mouth, open again, filling with rainwater and risk and someone else's mouth. the rhythm of my bass through a haze of smoke and altered consciousness. the movement of my hips and the surface of my neck opening up as I arch my back. hating the silence. hitting the highway at 90 mph. full moons. the charge on my skin in different contexts. negative and positive poles reversing. the fluctuating quantity of your body and the half-life of its distance. decisions I make without thinking to ask. never needing any permission but my own. crossing state lines. staring out the window while you drive. remembering how to scream. hearing something break deep in my throat. what it sounds like when I forget to reinforce the wall. the muscle I cannot unclench. the brake I cannot release. the reality I cannot ignore. the reason I still cannot scream. Welcome to my brain. The thought of you is like putting a cigarette to my lips (breathe) I know I can't (forget) Memory is a reef. Complex as a cortex. hair tangled naked there is nothing (in between) skin nerves mineyours it was not supposed to be like this. tellmetellme try to that you are not as close as (airandsmoke) I do not believe. I (breathe)

The dangly tinsel of life no longer feels in any way important to me. Do stupid, superficial things like clothes and image and status really matter? No. I always would've said no, but some part of me would think, yeah, but... what would people think if I did X... or if I didn't do X... And now I truly, deep down, don't care. Few things are more meaningless to me than shallow appraisals and there are few things I have come to resent more. So if I don't close the goddamn shade once or twice, what does it really matter? I wouldn't have done very well at all back in the day when women were expected to be something I'm not. That would have sucked. And at the same time, I think I would've been far better off if I lived in a culture were people courted each other for a while, got to figure out what they wanted and got to know each other, and then got married. Even serial monogamy is a little upsetting to me at times. I know very few people who see things the way I do in terms of relationships and emotions, but I think I'm just not suited to the have-a-relationship/have-sex/break-up sequence that everyone else seems to be A-OK with. I'm not A-OK with that. I don't find it appealing. And I don't need to date dozens of people in order to figure out what I want. I know what is good and what I want. Even if I'd never had chocolate before in my life, I could eat it for the first time and say, "hey, that's really yummy." I wouldn't need to sample several dozen different kinds to make that assessment. And when we're talking people, the concept of "sampling" is abhorrent to me. I'm not saying that other people can't do it or that I'd judge them for it, it's just not right for me and I'm realizing that. i am what i am... (a girl who despises lonely nights thinking) p.s. if you'r reading this (which, i hope you're not because i'm drunk and rambling) i hope your day has improved and you're feeling much better now. oh yeah, and i really miss you. (uh. yes, already)

today i was asked to write up a "job description" for myself. despite the fact that i think it's the most rediculous thing i've ever heard, i did it anyway. here's what i came up with: Jennifer -Manages and Underwrites entire lloyds of london book of business including, but not limited to, policy issuance, endorsement issuance, bordereaux preparation, and underwriting cancellations -servicing brokers on all lines of business. -Handles Workers Compensation, Umbrella, and BOP Insurance Placement -Manages all NJ Tax Filings for both Brooks and NY Excess -Analyzes inspection reports, locations, risks, loss scenarios, etc. -accepts or rejects renewal/new property and casualty business. -provides recommendations for complex cases, including bookeeping "problems". -Familiar with a variety of the field's concepts, practices, laws, and procedures. -Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. -Performs a variety of other tasks. -Leads and directs the work of others. and to think they thought all i ever did was sleep ...

tuesday it is. hmph. i have not been a very good girl this week, so far. i almost missed work entirely on monday, and was late again today. i don't know. sometimes i just can't keep my shit together, you know. i need to find something to look forward to. i'm starting to feel very trapped in my current situation. When i wake up in the morning, all i can think about is how i don't even want to get out of bed. but i do. i do it every day. (admittedly, some days later than others) i think i am starting to learn how to handle these feeling more maturely, but i still have a lot of work to do on this. i need to feel better about myself. i need to something for me. in any event, i just registered for summer classes. I am going for an accounting degree. I have always been good with numbers, and it's something that i can easily apply to my insurance background. i think that just knowing that i am qualified to do something else in the future, will make me feel a lot better about where i am and what i'm doing now. plus, i think some extra knowledge in the money management field never hurt anyone.... more than that, it's something that will make me feel good about myself, make my father proud, and hopefully provide me with something to fall back on, just in case my world continues to crumble around me. I realize now that i never got to choose my career. I started working in this business when i was 13 years old. My father got sick not too long after, and no matter how much i disliked the pressure and people i had to deal with, it just didn't feel like leaving was the right thing to do. Now, i find myself in a similar situation, but without all of the *perks* that came along with working for my father. I dn't see myself going anywhere. I don't see any opportunity here. All i see is me - doing exactly what i'm doing now - every day - for eternity. And hating evety second of it. i don't know why i am so excited about going back to school, but i am. it's been such a long time since i have been able to do something for myself, and it feels so good to have something to look forward to again. something i actually want. All of this was around before of course, but it was different. I used to feel good about what i did. I took pride in certain things, things that i no longer have the luxury of doing. I wish i could write more, but you never know who's going to be reading this. The bottom line is that i know what i want to do now. I know what i have to do to get there. And i'm starting the process right now. before it's too late. And I'll get it done this time. I really will.

tonight i'm pondering some of my feelings. yes, the good ones. i want to fall asleep so that friday will appear, but i'm not completely sure that's going to happen anytime soon. i'm feeling wrestless. it's as if my bed suddenly feels cold and half empty. hey. did you notice that i actually utilized my tab key and created paragraphs in my last entry? i just realized that. i'm so proud. i must be delerious.

I woke up this morning, as I have woken up so many mornings recently, into the world I wanted. I believed it would happen, and it did. We do what we need to do to survive, and in those moments there is no right or wrong, there is no propriety. There is only instinct. There is only what we have to do to get ourselves to the next breath. Only later do we turn to the matter of understanding what these choices have made us. I have learned what happens when I feel the wall against my back. I become efficient, minimal, brutal. Cut the lines and take down the sails and get below deck. Life becomes a matter of risk assessment, of contingency plans and how far I am willing to go. My father always taught me that the greatest strength is in perseverance. I will win not because I am quicker, or more powerful, or more skilled. I will win simply because I can endure more. Because I will outlast you. The challenge is knowing when the battle is over. When you do not need those instincts anymore, when you should not react to every touch like a blow. I guess the real question is: will we ever learn?
Today, I am feeling awfully troubled about world events. I want things to resolve themselves. now.

somthimes things happen. often, they aren't what we'd like them to be. i don't know. i guess i'm a little frightened right now. (the reason i'd prefer not to discuss) but, i know that as long as things are ok today, then chances are they will be ok tomorrow. at least, this is what i'm trying to convince myself of. it's hard to know what to expect from people sometimes. it's even harder to expect nothing at all. that's what i'm trying to learn how to do. this may sound silly, but the smallest things can be such a pleasant suprise when you dont expect/want/thinktheyshouldhappen. "sometimes the greatest lessons are learned at the most unexpected times."

i spent the weekend thinking. and thinking. and thinking. and thinking. about.... butterflies. and the fact that i love them. i spent the weekend not thinking about what was, or what will be, but what is. and i loved every single minute of it.

"As long as you are alive and aware.... your obligation is to experience as much of the world as possible as vividly as possible... The tragedy, from an existential perspective, is that many people never do this. They lead the unexamined life, they never realize how lucky they are to be alive and aware, and they eventually lose their awareness never having realized what a special gift it was." - David Funder, The Personality Puzzle Things I know to be true about myself: (you and I are one and the same) I am a very intense person. I experience life in a very vivid way. My mind is my greatest tool, but I live by my heart. I make most decisions with a combination of the two, but if you ask me to choose, my heart will always win. I need to understand life. I've been doing some pretty heavy reading lately, and i'm realizing that it's all about trying to understand what happens to you in the context of the way you see life. You have this perception of why things happen, and what they mean, and who you are. And then things happens, and you make mistakes. And you don't know why, you don't know what that means, and you don't know who it makes you. (and maybe you find a way to reconcile that, to understand it, or maybe you lie and bury it in yourself and destroy everything around you trying to do penance. Maybe you hate your life so much you decide to break it irrevocably into pieces. ) you don't understand, at that moment, how irrevocable life can be. How an action, or a choice can change your life so permanently and significantly. When you're younger, nothing seems permanent. You don't understand how not everything can be fixed, how a single choice can enter your life with an impact so catastrophic it changes every moment that follows. You act carelessly, and you pay for it. Kierkegaard spoke of two armies, and a knight invited to fight for both. "He chose one side, was defeated and taken prisoner. As prisoner he was brought before the conqueror and was foolish enough to offer him his services on the the conditions originally offered. I wonder if the conqueror would not say to him: My dear fellow... at one time you could have chosen differently, but now everything is changed." So it is, and so it must be, if our choices are to mean anything. To understand me, and what has happened, you need to understand where I come from. You need to understand my world, the way I love, the unity I seek, the weaknesses in my wall and the way I have built it. You need to understand my bottom lines, my absolutes, and the desperate ruthlessness I am willing to employ to hold fast to them. You need to speak my language. I have not spoken it for so long. And to live in silence is to never fully grasp the way life intersects with you. words are the way we take what happens within and make it external. The way we know. I am beginning to understand.

We need to live to completion. All of us. I do. and so do you. Looking back upon my life, the moments, the eras of my life I am happiest with are the ones I appreciated- the ones I was completely conscious of, the ones I swallowed completely, the instants I used to their fullest. We waste so much time complaining, taking things for granted, refusing to accept this moment or that feeling. I would rather eat food and taste it for as long as I can, to feel the texture and temperature and every ingredient that was added... this is not to say I never swallow anything whole. It is simply that I do not remember it when I do. We lose so much of life to lack of recollection, lack of imprint. When we don't write things down, when we rush through them so we don't have to feel too much, trying to get to the next place and the next place and.... When was the last time I was here, and nowhere else? It was the he other day, actually. Every second full of sensation, and there is nothing I would have said or done differently, no other way I would have moved. I was deliberate, I was aware, I was present. And i was thinking: this is what I want every day, every morning, every second. This is what I want.

"I started to accept the mess I'm in. I know that mess spelled backwards is ssem and I felt much better armed with that information. " -Tori Amos Life's just full of uncertainty, isn't it? Some people are far more OK with the uncertainty than others. I can live with many aspects of my life scattered to winds, but there are other things I'd just rather have set in concrete. This, of course, will never happen, because all things in live are subject to failure and unforeseeable collapse. I would prefer not to worry about this, I would prefer to take it in stride or even with hopeful anticipation. I would rather smile than reach for a cigarette when life throws a curve ball my way. It's all about finding peace. I feel like I've been waiting and waiting and waiting for something to settle out, but then there's always the next thing and the next thing, and soon X years of your life have gone by and there's no sign of level ground. Because there is no level ground. Lesson of the century: I need to take things as they come, each day, and not waste the time "in between" by wishing it away or wishing it different. I need to be thankful for what i have, and less distracted by what i don't. the end.

Monday, again. ugh. This weekend was a series of mishaps ranging from arguments with my sister to the death of my coworker and friend's son. I feel sad and i'm having difficulty working. i guess that's expected, though. I know there is absolutely nothing i can say that will make him feel better, and i really wish there was. I guess that's the bottom line.

hmm. where to begin. last night? ok. fine. i went to manhattan to meet up with my sister. she was supposed to meet me at 9:30 at Seen's Tattoo, but never showed. Many hours later she finally arrived with about 10 corn fed michigan kids. don't get me wrong, they were all very nice - but not exactly what i had in mind for the evening. I was SUPPOSED to go to brooklyn, to hang out with this guy jimmy and his roomate. Of course, he had no cell phone, and i couldn't get in touch with him to tell him what happened. So, we all ended up going to this crappy bar across the street from the shop. I was so upset, i was slamming shots and cran & absolutes until i finally threw a hissy fit, and broke down into tears. It was fucking pathetic. Seriously, i think i was just looking forward to hanging out Jimmy all day, and i was so scared he was going to get mad at me, that i was overly pissed off at everyone in a ten foot radius of me. ugh. anyway, i finally got home at 5 am. tired. upset. and drunk as shit..... I woke up at 4:00, and called him. Thankfully, he didn't sound very mad. That made me feel a lot better, but still, i am really upset that i fucked up. The messages i got this morning revealed that he was waiting for us at a bar until 1 in the friggin morning. i feel like such a shit head. ugh. my name is jenna. and i am queen of all fuck ups. thankfully i got a rain check for sunday, so hopefully i'll have better news to report then. i think tonight i'm going to AC tonight with some friends, if they actually call me back. Right now, i'm getting ready to go visit my mom and pick up some money, then over to my friends house to pick up some trees. . . bah. i'm still grumpy. someone shoot me please.

i have too much floating around in my head today, to try to put any of it into words. i feel pretty good though, really. i just made dinner. tonight was chicken cutlets, mashed red potatos, and sweet corn. it was good, and now i'm full. i think i'm going to drink some more wine, watch pump up the volume, and go to bed early. friday cannot come soon enough..

Yesterday was Typical Typhoon Tuesday with its crazy back to back calls and astronomically long hold times, and it's continued into this morning. *shrug* . maybe this afternoon it will get better. Who knows...who cares. Yesterday i wanted to blow up my entire office, really. After work, i ended up out in south jersey and had dinner and some drinks with Traci. It was a great time as always. And ther was even an added perk.. an unexpected message which truly made my night. In any event, fortunately one of my girls showed up to work today, so instead of having a heart attack, my mental energies are being poured into deep consideration of who I am right now and where I thought I would be at this time in my life. Conclusion: Even the best laid plans do not always succeed. I really do live life day by day without any serious '5 Year Plan' in the back of my mind. but, a certain spiritual unrest has presented itself and I am at a loss on how to pacify this need. I mean, it's not a real surprise since I have never found the answer before, but such is the ever turning wheel of life. I think I shall slam the last gulp of this coffee and grab some lunch, and contemplate the meaning of humanity. Have a nice day.

I hate Mondays! bah. You ever see that movie office space? well, mondays make me want to take all of my fax machines to a field and kick the shit out of them while NWA songs blast in the background. did i mention that BOTH of my assistants called in sick? haha. just my luck. Anyway, onto nicer things... This weekend was pretty cool. Saturday night Traci came over to visit. We took Michael to NYC to go to Manitobas for drinks. First we went to Seen's Tattoo and met up with Shamrock and *The Dark Lord* haha. Then we all headed over to Boxers for dinner. After that, we took a cab to manitobas, and man, the place was PACKED. I drank entirely too much while i was there, and proceeded to get my ass kicked at pool. Traci, on the other hand KICKED ass. she is a hustler in the making, i'm telling you! Ok, so we made it home around 5 in the morning. I was so drunk, i couldn't sleep. I think i watched a few episodes of Six Feet Under on DVD, and eventually passed out. As for sunday, i was basically a waste of air most of the day. At 6 i FINALLy got off my ass, and made dinner for my friends. I made Baked Ziti, Garlic Bread, and an Onion/Tomato Salad. mmmm. it came out really good, if i don't say so myself. Now I'm just waiting for Chris to call... *grin*

oh yes. it is saturday, finally. last night i ended up drinking a bottle of white wine to the head, watching the last century of sex on the history channel, and passing out by 10:00. i woke up about an hour ago, and now i'm at the office. working on staurday is by far the most productive, because we are free from client's phone calls. i am very happy about that, because i have a lot of catching up to do. i must have bound 20 accounts yesterday, and i got ZERO paperwork done. i really hope i get some of that accomplished today. In any event, after work Traci is coming over to chill! i am still excited. She is my favorite drinking partner, by far. Plus it helps that we have EVERYTHING in common, so there is never anything lacking in the conversation department. The other day Frank (not my partner, my old school friend) and i decided to start up a new business, which we will cleverly refer to as "a modeling agency". I can see already that it will be successful. In addition to already reserving the company name and beginning the incorporation process, I've done hours worth of research and already found quite a few willing females to kick things off. I can't wait to tell Traci about it, because i'm sure she'll have some involvement too, in the future. I'm glad all of this is going on, because there are a few things going on in my personal life that i desperately need distraction from. The newest problem being, that i'm starting to catch feelings for a certain guy, who in return shows little to no interest (ouch), and the less suprising problem being that now BOTH of my parents are currently ill, instead of just my father. ugh. anyway. guess who came home the other night? that's right, my sister. i haven't gotten a chance to see her yet, because apparently she brought a bunch of freinds home from school, but i am looking forward to that too. (don't you just love how whenever i start to think of something that makes me sad, i quickly switch into thoughts that make me happy?) well, i do.

I am so exhausted. last night traci, julie, michael, and i drove out to maryland for a bme bbq. It was nearly three hours away from here, so we left around two - and made it up there a little before five. man, maryland is awful! there is nothing to do, nowhere to go, and nothing to eat! i would kill myself if i lived there, haha. luckily the state was no reflection of the bbq. we got to see a lot of people. old friends and new. there was suspensions, pullings, and fire play. oh what a night! i don't know. i guess it was good for me to get out of town for the day. this weekend i was feeling really sad and alone (for no good reason, other than that i'm too sensitive). all i can say, is that i am so lucky to have such great friends. just when i was feeling completely down, they pulled me up again.

fuck ups. fuck ups. fuck ups. i feel so dissapointed. my fault, i'm sure. but still. i can't help but feel like this. thank god for traci and wreak. they are my best friends. they came here last night. we made dinner. we watched movies. we waited. i shouldn't have waited. i shouldn't have been scared to call again. why am i so afraid of bothering him? he never gave me a reason to feel like this. fuck, i don't know. traci thinks there is more to it. maybe she's right. maybe all these feelings are in my head, and my head alone. maybe i'm a mistress that's sitting on your shelf. maybe i'm nothing at all. or maybe i'm crazy for doubting this at all. I have always said it is about figuring out where the next foot is going to fall, and not thinking about anything beyond that. I can do that at least. for today. *waits for the sadness to evaoprate*

welcome to my boredom post. I suppose I could read some more, and probably will before I go to sleep, but I thought I'd opt for a little web self-expression before I go in that direction. Today was pretty productive and enjoyable... I finished off "the ethical slut" after work, took a nice bubble bath, and made a snack. things are starting to slide into perspective for me. That's why the passage of time is so essential. If you wait long enough you can generally get objectivity and clarity. I am beginning to think that choices need to be made. I believe in being patient and understanding of where people are. But as a matter of respect to myself, there have to be limits. I'm not a toy, I'm not a piece of ass and I'm not anyone's doormat. I have been treated like all of those things at various points in my life, and I sure as hell won't let it happen again. The trick is not to do that to anyone else either, ever again. It is my responsibility to draw lines. It's just hard to know where to draw them, when so many things are so very vague. I don't know what i'm talking about. and i'm babbling again. this book i just finished reading touched me in a strange way. i can't exactly explain it now, because i'm working on an article that might put it all into perspective for me. we all know that i can't possibly make sense of all of these new found thoughts to you, when i haven't truly even begin to understand them myself - yet. i've gotten through a two page outline so far. one page dedicated to things that i cannot accept, and another dedicated to things that i desire. by the way, i'm proudly learning the difference between wants and needs. that may seem rediculous to you, but i'm beginning to realize that most people are completely incapable of drawing that line. i'm making it my business to do this, because i'm tired of feeling empty and insecure, when - i really don't have any reason to feel that way. i want to learn how to verbalize my feelings, instead of dropping hints and expecting people to read my fucking mind. this is number one on my priorities this week. and i think i may have done that yesterday, for the first time. instead of allowing my juvenile feelings and insecurity issues to take over, and saying something like "you make me feel like shit because you haven't: blah blah blah", i went with, what felt like, a much more accurate thing to say "it would make me feel much better if you could: blah blah blah" small statement. big change. and god damnit, it made me feel good to speak like that, and really mean it. (even if it doesn't happen - and that i truly mean) obviously, i don't want to feel like i'm not good enough, or not important enough, for anything or anyone. i don't think anyone does. if there's one thing i got out of this book (much elaboration to follow after a few friends read too, and i have time to discuss this further) it's that no one has control over my feelings besides me. the blame game got old a long time ago, and that's the truth. but actually accepting the fact that i am in total and complete control of the way that i allow myself to feel, well - that's a new concept for your girl jenna. and she's taking that ball and running with it. people can't read minds. (another new concept) so how do you know if i want more or less? softer or harder? that you're doing an amazing job? that you're making me happy? that i'm making myself crazy wondering? you don't know. and me looking out the window while you drive instead of looking in your eyes and saying what i feel ain't fucking helping. can you believe it took me nearly 24 years and several failed relationships to figure that one out. hah! all those teachers must have been dead wrong when they said i was smart. and i wonder why no one ever told me that growing up felt so liberating. had i known, i might have stopped running from this adulthood thing ages ago. *sigh* ok, ok. so i have to continue working on my outline now. then i'm going to read a little poetry, and get some sleep.

things i want to remember to talk about (in no particular order) 1. my headache 2. chris and his good omens 3. poetry in the bath tub 4. wreak's mom's accident 5. sunday with willy 6. madball at cbgb's 7. monday with jimmy 8. discontent ** e n d o f r e p o r t ** (don't you hate that?) don't worry, i'm not done yet. ok. so. i have an awful headache tonight (1). i can't seem to make it go away. i probably shouldn't be typing, as staring at a monitor surely won't help - but fuck it. you all already know that i'm a computer addict. (i had an action packed week, hence the lack of constant updates) omitting my misery within the work place through out the week, my weekend was fairly fun. unforunately i can't really remember what order everything happened in, because i was drunk a good portion of the time, but i surely remember having fun. i honestly can't remember what i did friday night (oh the woes of a pot head) i think it involved cooking dinner for seth, and chris coming over, but i'm not exactly sure that wasn't the night before. but i do remember that, on satuday, julie came over to hang out. we drank, went out for pizza, and watched lots of lame movies on TV. it may not sound overly exciting to you, but i had a great time. she fucking rocks. i think she left pretty late, because i know i fell asleep within two minutes of her walking out the door. sunday, i woke up really early. i was bored as shit, so i decided to take a trip to the freehold mall. when i got there the stores hadn't even opened up yet, but i was too focused on not going home, so i walked around for a while. then willie called me, and it turned out he was at the jersey gardens mall at that very moment, and all of their stores were closed too. we found the thing pretty funny, since we both knew that the only reason we were at a mall sunday morning was so that we could make it to the madball show later on, in clean clothes, without doing any laundry. seriously. who does that? (us). anyway, after the whole plan-making-ceremony, chris called me. he agreed to meet me at the book store again, so i headed to borders, and went inside. he eventually found me sitting on the floor of the "speculation" section, browsing a book called the "new girl order". (how very embarrassing). ok, so - we made it over to the sci fi section, and as i bitched and moaned about my inability to choose more than one book, chris decided to reccomend GOOD OMENS, by Gaiman and Terry Pratchett. (2) Then, of course, he proceeded to lift his pant leg, and revealed a tattoo of the characters on the (angeldemon) cover of the book. I'd be blaintently lying if i didn't say that that i was more than intrigued, so (ofcourse) i bought it. OH MY GOD! (that line would be much funnier if you picked up a copy) THIS BOOK IS INCREDIBLE! (seriously, so far - this is one of the best books i've ever read! no shit.) alright, so the point is - a new found respect for chris's ability to recommend books has been born. i don't think i ever want to go book shopping without him again. Alright, so i also picked up some other books while we were there: Another E.E.Cummings, R. Kostelanetz Betting on The Muse, C Bukowski Bone Palace Ballet, C Bukowski which brings me to poetry in the bath tub. (3) when i got home from borders, i stripped down and took a nice bubble bath, with a glass of merlot in one hand, and my brand new copy of betting on the muse in the other. mmm. it was so wonderful. i felt like i was (literally) washing my cares away. there's something about bukowski's work that makes me feel like i'm not doing so bad (or maybe i am, but i'm just not alone in it). haha. shit. i can't explain it. i guess i shouldn't have to. "the pleasures of the damned are limited to brief moments of happiness; like the eyes in the look of a dog, like a square of wax, like a fire taking the city hall, the county, the continenet, like fire taking hair of maidens and monsters; and hawks buzzing in peach trees, the sea running between their claws, Time drunk and damn, everything burning, everything wet, everything fine." Betting on The Muse, C Bukowski (page 29) words like that relax me. i guess words in general tend to relax me. *sigh* alright so, i guess you're wondering why i was so in need of relaxion. well, at some point during my wonderful day, i received another phone call from willy, telling me that wreak's mom had been in an auto accident. (4) at that point, willy was still under the impression that she may have even broken her neck, so of course i was very concerned. i must have called wreak five hundred times, but i didn't get in touch with him until willy and i got into the city, but it all ended up ok, and she was fine. thankfully she's already home. which reminds me, i need to send her flowers in the morning. man, my mind does not work in chronological order at all. i picked willy up after my fantastic bubble bath, and we drove into the city.(5) we parked somewhere (nearly 12 blocks from CBGB's), and decided to walk. It was beautiful outside. we stopped at some mexican place for dinner, and had a margarita. upon leaving - we decided to (literally) take a tour of the village bar scene. we decided that we would stop at every bar we passed, and have a shot of tequila. needless to say, that by the time we reached CB's we were completely shit faced. Wreak eventually met us there, and we proceeded to have a great time. I made my way into the dressingpotsmokingroom and had a seat. we smoked, and drank, and laughed, and caught up with some old friends. it was really nice. then, pretendyouresuprised, i ran off to the gallery with some beautiful punk girl - and got kisses. i felt somewhat bad about that, for no real reason. i have no spoken arrangement with anyone, but i'll admit it - it just didn't feel right. iobviouslyihavecaughtsomefeelings. in any event, the show was great and i had a fun time. i love my madball. (6) alright, so i went home late sunday night, went to work monday, felt like shit, and then went home at 6:45. took a shower, and then....drove to brooklyn to hang out with jimmy. (7) he'd been on vacation all week, so when i heard he was home - i decided to ditch the nap idea, and take a ride. i had a really nice night too, as always. we watched TV with his roomate and drank a bottle of some great australian merlot. it was well worth the trip. this morning he woke me up mad early, and i made it to work by 9. and that, i never saw coming. ahh. finally. the discontent. (8) actually, i changed my mind about talking about this now. i have no right to piss and moan after all of the fun i just spoke about having. i suppose i'll save this part for another day. godi'mgladthat'sfinallydone. *** e n d o f r e p o r t ***

i got a lot done at work this week. i've really been concentrating on getting things done, that i've been pushing to the side for far too long. i've decided that rather than focusing on making money for other people, it's better to focus on less lucritive projects that tend to pile up and stress me out. so far, so good. i have prepare our nj quartely taxes next week, and that will be a hell of a lot easier to concentrate on when there aren't five thousand files surrounding me. you can actually see the surface of my desk right now. it's a rare occurence, but welcomed just the same. *sigh* time for a glass of wine and some reading.

i think I'm at that place i've been trying to get to for so long. (i always say this, yes i know) but, i just don't feel like I want to hurt myself anymore. i'm not willing to allow it. i think a lot of that was the aftermath of the stuff I've gone through. i don't know what psychological mechanisms cause those feelings, but there's a desire for damage, for emotional self-mutilation. when I got very ill from my ulcers this past summer, there was a part of me that liked it. when I woke up with cigarette burns this summer (which are still a mystery) part of me liked that. and that's just freakin' sick. i don't want that anymore. i am ready to be healthy, emotionally and physically. And no one could do that for me, no one can make me choose upward movement instead of a downward spiral. i have to forgive myself. and it's not that i don't have regrets. i have great big giant ugly regrets. there are things I would give anything to go back and change. but I am standing here right now and I am going to stop digging the hole. yes, i still have the scars. and yes, there are still burn marks on my legs. but that's it. no more. i am strong now, and i'm not seeing the world through a lens of pain and self-loathing anymore. maybe that means that things can get better again. maybe that means that I can help someone else on his path to self-forgiveness. i don't know. i can only work with what I am given, with the doors that are opened to me. i can only do the best I can. maybe that's finally enough.

traci and i had some well deserved fun last night! we met up with enrique and willie and we all went to the 640 for dinner. we ate all kinds of good stuff, like garlic shrimp, calamari, italian sausage, brocolli rabe, and filet mignon. mmmm. eddie is such an amazing chef. after all that, we went to cheeks (ooh, the tittie bar) and got trashed. there was this one girl in a yellow outfit that was so god damn hot. traci and i practically fell in love with her. then she walked over to us and said "how can i get up in there". we were like "haha we wish". we hung out there for a few hours, had a lot of laughs, and then everyone came over my house afterwards for more drinking and playing on the internet. it's 11:41 and half of us are still asleep. i hate daylight savings time, but i love my traci. we are going to barnes & nobles soon to buy books. i think we're going to start the atkins diet this week and get all sexy so we can make boys cry this summer. watch out new jersey. haha. thisgirlishappy.

i laid in bed this morning torturing myself mentally for about a half and hour. that needs to stop. it needs to be summer and i need to clear my head and tuck certain things into the background. not purge them, not ignore them, just tuck them aside so that I can be alive. i need to live because the alternative is not what i want. i don't choose that. i wrote a song late last night. it is about maps and love. i think it is pretty good.
i feel like i haven't slept in three years. I wish I still did Tae Kwon Do. I could really get off on a little harmless physical violence right now. Something. Anything. damnit..

ack. tense. must decompress. why does my family stress me out so much? my mother really got under my skin today. she got in a car accident. all i wanted to do was help her, but she kept picking on me and ordering me around and taking out her control issues on me. i just can't handle that right now. i'm in my room right now, and that at least feels peaceful and cool and good. i only have a few minutes left though, as julie and traci are on their way here. i'm glad they are coming, but i can't stop thinking about how i need some space in my life. i want to write and play music and breathe. i don't want silence, per se... i have plenty of silence in my life. i have deafening silence from the corners in my life that most desperately need words. shit. am I a bad person? i never used to think so. i know a lot of good people care about me... i have always liked myself and been basically proud of my life and my beliefs and my choices. i just do not feel proud of myself now and feel like such a fuck-up. goddamn it. i finally feel strong enough to fight now, but the things in my life that i really should take a stand against would.. well... i just can't... yet. i keep hearing these second hand reports about how much pain my father is in and it is incredibly upsetting to me. i wish I could talk to him. no, i just wish i could understand him when he spoke. i wish I could hug him and listen to him talk for hours and help him sort things out and make sense of things, which god knows I haven't been able to do alone. but I can't do that. i am pain to him. which is the most terrible thing I can imagine being. he resents me. he resents that i have the responsibility of taking care of everyone, and that i struggle with it - because there's nothing in the world he wants more than to be able to provide for all of us again. i don't want to hurt him so i don't speak. i never mention how hard it is, or how all of the responsibility is taking a toll on me. i just shut up and wish that i could bandage his wounds. i wish I could love this life he's givin to me, knowing how much blood sweat and tears he put into getting me here. i can't forgive myself for feeling like this. and i don't know if I ever will. but still, at the root of things, i am not in the same kind of despair he is. i have this confidence that things are somehow going to be all right, that they will get better, that it will all work out. that everyone will be ok. allison will graduate college. get married. be happy. my dad will find peace. my mom will not always have to do so much care taking. i'll be able to provide more for all of them than i do now. it feels like a promise. i don't know why i believe it... shouldn't I be cynical and jaded and bitter? i'm not really. not yet, at least. if i'm strong enough to stand on my feet and face all of this now, it has to improve eventually. right?

i really don't feel well today. my stomach is in knots. it's just one of those nerve things, i'd assume. my ulcers tend to flare up when i'm just starting to calm down emotionally. of course, this is not the first time i've been through this. i wonder how many other people out there get physically sick from thinking?

she was cuffed to the truth like the truth was a chair bright interrogation light in her eyes her conscience lit a cigarette and just stood there waiting for her to crack waiting for her to cry his face scampered through her mind like a roach across a wall it made her heart soar it made her skin crawl they said, we got this confession we just need for you to sign why don't you just cooperate and make this easier on us all there was light and then there was darkness but there was no line in between and asking her heart for guidance was like pleading with a machine cuz joy, it has its own justice and dreams are languid and lawless and everything bows to beauty when it is fierce and when it is flawless on the table were two ziploc baggies containing her eyes and her smile they said, we're keeping these as evidence 'til this thing goes to trial meanwhile anguish was fingering solace in another room down the hall both were love's accomplices but solace took the fall now look at her book of days it's the same on every page and she's got a little tin cup with her heart in it to bang along the bars of her rib cage

i just got home from chris's house. i am going to sleep like a baby tonight, i can tell already. i'm so lucky to know that one. being around him always makes me feel happy.

rotting. (again) you think that on my day off, i'd do something productive. (wouldn't you?). i'm not. not even close. i'm running out of phrases for my thoughts. i'm tired of saying the same thing over, and over, and over again. things are less complicated than ever, in a way. and more than ever, in another. i've given up on a lot, but i'm not tired of waiting for things to get better. i'm becoming comfortable with this. maybe it will never happen, but if i keep waiting - that means i have hope. and hope accompanies change on occasion, i hear. this weekend was nice. i spent a lot of time with willy. he's having girlfriend troubles, and it's good that i'm around to keep him company. i guess, in a way, i miss having someone to want to say goodnight to every night, but i'd be lying if i didn't admit that right now, where i am is the best place i could possibly be right now. alone . i was watching casablanca for the millionth time the other day, and i noticed something. it was strange that it never occured to me before. i was watching the last scene, and found myself starting to think to myself (like i usually do), "what the hell is he doing!?! why is he letting her go!?!". and then it came to me. feelings do not dictate everything. some things are more important. and you were right. all along. currently playing: AFI, morningstar

today is a crazy day. i am planning my business trip to london for next month, and i have so much to do. eeep! p.s. people need to stop taking my writing so seriously. for instance, last night i was not writing to anyone specific. i was just drunk and bored. for god's sake, this is writing. ONLY writing. how many times do i have to tell you people that before you get it?

so, what do i do now? do i just resign you to the title of "the great tragedy of my life"? cry quietly when I stumble across a photo of us, when I'm 40 and married with children? i would get down on my knees and beg but i don't have the strength. i have broken myself in half. i have nothing left to offer except myself. If that isn't enough, what can I say? go lose yourself in someone else, in a haze of pot and alcohol and someone else's skin. i have nothing left to give you but everything. i'm very, very drained. i'm sort of broken. i have pulled myself up on the bootstraps of optimism for a very long time, and i guess i just need some sort of sign that things are going to work out. some would say I've just been given one, but i... just feel so tired and so very inadequate. i don't know what i want to do. go to bed? keep on typing? call you? give up? will someone just please urlLink tell me what to do? i'm so tired of deciding. i always make the wrong decisions anyway.
my head hurts i'm drinking banrock station merlot i'm listening to marvin gaye i'm alone i don't want to be (my, i'm, i'm, i'm, i) the rant of a selfish girl - take one.

um... i don't know that I have anything terribly new to say right now. i think i just want to keep talking. i am pretty terrified right now. want to know why? because this is my life. this is real. this is a big fucking deal. i know that 90-95% of life is the little stuff, and i pretty much shrug my shoulders at it and step away from it and continue on my merry way of attempted equilibrium. but this is my life. every once in a while these past couple days i've slipped into normal mode and the way i'm accustomed to dealing with things. and then I remember everything that has gone on and everything that is going on. And i realize that this is one of the focal points of light I used to talk about, the moments in your life where things converge and things are decided and... i'm scared. still... some part of me has a peace about it. because I think that whatever is right will happen. What I want, what I think is right does not necessarily dictate this, and I understand that. But I can hope. For a while there I was beginning to lose hope... in more than this, in everything. But right now there is hope in my heart. I have waited a very long time and I know how to wait. So I will do that. p.s. my urlLink webcam is up and running, finally.

things to talk about are plentiful. i've been so very busy - and my mind is acting like one of those phone booth shaped glass cages that money blows around in, and the contestant gets to keep whatever they catch. well, except it's filled with thoughts, not money. (obviously) anyway i have hardly updated at all in the last week or so, so it's catch up time. i know i wont be able to write about it all now, since i have a ton if shit to do, but im leaving myself a reminder so that hopefully i fill in the rest when i find a few minutes. note to self: (don't forget) rain on my parade the t-shirt riot the stolen bedroom crying drunk people the bme bbq the stolen bedroom (yes, again) the tattoo convention cbgb's the stranded pennsylvanian the 3 hours of sleep that cost me $150 :::[deep breath]::: friday night one of my business associates from CT came to jersey to see the races at englishtown. he got to my office kind of early, and helped me out with some pointers on applications and stuff. anyway, we left my office around 4 and headed over to the urlLink track . we weren't there long before it started raining, but we managed to catch a t shirt riot and witness two records being broken, (not too bad if you ask me). after that we left, since it was obvious the thing was being called, and we grabbed dinner & shot some pool. i got home around nine, because traci was supposed to sleep over, but i ended up falling asleep on the couch and traci ended up staying in maryland. when i woke up there were two people sleeping in my room (that i didn't know) and the entrance was so blocked i could hardly go in. way to start the weekend from hell. anyway, luckily i had some clothes in the dryer - so i was able to take a shower without disturbind the strangers in my bedroom. cough. cough. then, one bad thing happened after another, none of which i care to discuss right now, because i need to stop being so pissed off before i go trying to make some sense out of all of it. let's just say that i am stressed out, and my body is ACHING. and no, you pervert, not that kind of sore. i played kickball, and sprained muscles i didn't even know i had. sigh. and, yes, of course there's urlLink pictures . time to do more work. more later.

this week at work, has been damn near impossible. my partner has been in london all week, and won't be back until monday. then, tuesday - lisa called out sick - leaving casey and i with four times the average work load (which is ten times more work than most people so in a year). sigh, i am tired. i think all of the chaos is leaving me feeling tired, and therefor all the little things are driving me crazy. it's funny how that works. lesigh. i was at the office until after 8 last night, and i'm still nowehre near caught up. christ. someone should come down here and help me out. last night when i got home from work, brian was outside my front door waiting for me. we watched south park, ate pizza, and chilled with my friend justin. it was a nice night. he hid these really cute hello kitty toys all over my apartment when i was in the shower too, it was really sweet. i fell asleep kind of early, and then i woke up at around three in the morning, crying. i don't remember what i was dreaming about, but whatever it was really shook me up. in any event, i'm hungry. bye.

i just want to cry. (and i did) because this is how I feel sometimes. like the most beautiful parts of me have been taken away, and nothing can bring them back. tonight i was talking with a couple of other kids, and watching us interact, I realized the fundamental difference between them and me. They're normal. In the best possible sense of the word. I'm not. everything is so heavy for me, like I'm pulling a hundred pound weight behind me everywhere I go. nothing is light, nothing is safe or easy. and we were talking and laughing... but it just didn't roll off me the way it was supposed to. I can't explain it. one of my frineds was telling me about what happens to organisms in the water when they come in contact with soap. They're lighter than the water, but the soap bonds to them and-- BLUB BLUB BLUB -- they sink to the bottom like stones. I feel like everything I touch or think or do just... sinks. i want to run away. But what am running away from? Myself. And wherever I go, I'm still there. I'm trapped in this body but it's too wounded and I want out. this page will make a really interesting psychological study someday. do any of you see it that way? those of you who know? this is how someone reacts, when... i'm sure I'll fascinate me someday.

i am just hungover, tired, and fed up today. i hate when i drink TOO much. i especially hate when i drink TOO much, and consequently don't remember conversations &/or things that i've done. that is NEVER a good thing. In any event, last night was still good in a sense. Traci and i ended up meeting an old "friend" (and i use the term friend losely) in new york. we went to this bar, and right off the bat he was acting like a total asshole. i can't understand people sometimes. i mean, why bother hanging out with people if you don't want to. does it make you feel good about yourself to sit around people you obviously don't like, and put them down and/or ignore them the whole night? hah. if he looked a his watch one more time i was going to rip his arm off. i swear. haha so, i drank too much, and i got angry, and we left.. we ended up going to some other bar up the road, where these really nice irish guys must have bought us a dozen shots of soco. hah. yeah that was what we needed. shots! after we went to a diner and tried to sober up for the drive home. looking back, we shouldn't have driven anywhere. but that's hind sight for you. too little, too late as always.. i don't know. sometimes i let myself hurt for no good reason. i'm really very tired of being like that. maybe it's time for another introspective week, who knows.. well, anyway - we made it home alive. it was very late, but i was trashed - so i made chris come over and hang out for a while. he is so nice. who the fuck drives over to a drunk person's house just because they say so, when the both of you have work at 9 am. hah. well, he did it. thanks chris.. mmm. so as for today - i'm pooped. i'm very much looking forward to going home and chillin out on the couch while i smoke massive amounts of pot. traci will hopefully come back over, and we'll probably end up drunk again, haha - but that's always fun. and i love my traci.. as for this weekend, we have ton's of plans. tomorrow we're going shopping for outfits to wear for the performace we're doing on sunday at the NYC EVENT. after that we're going to her dad's house for a cinco de mayo party, and after that we're heading to jean's house for another bbq. hah. i'm sure we'll be trashed then too.. sunday morning i'm sure we'll have the obligatory sunday omlettes and bagels.. we'll wait for lori to come over, and then we're all off to brooklyn for the event. It should be really interesting, and we're going to get to see a lot of friends, which is always nice. i doubt i'll have time to update this thing again until monday, so i hope all of you have a great weekend..
