drunk again. can't sleep. in the past, when I came to the point of total catastrophe, i would imagine a reprieve. i would imagine that through the force of sheer belief i could make it a mistake. and I would be wrong, over and over, until I realized that grief is a disease, that it ravages and relapses, sleeps in the body waiting to be awakened. and when it struck me down last week in all its recognizable agony, i stopped imagining. i put an IV directly into the vein and swallowed the slow drip of despair again and finally and again and I felt myself spill over and i wondered if it had finally gone too far if I was finally gone if there would be anything left when it was done or whether it was time to move on from faith from who I was but i would like to raise a glass now to the first unbreaking of my heart. i would like to thank the hand that pulled me back from the first white flag I ever contemplated waving. you are the first man who has not profoundly disappointed me, who has given me something besides irresponsibility and apologies, and you are the only one who has ever unbroken me who has ever restored some kind of hope to me who has ever received what I offered with thankfulness, the only one who has ever tried to know what i was

aggrivation. i have a tendency to write about things that happen a few days or a few months after they occur, just to make sure that i'm being as completely rational as possible while i express my emotions. with that being said, i'd like to let you know about my sunday night. as those of you who read this on a regular basis know, sunday night i came home from my business trip in london. it was nearly an eight hour flight, prior to which i has spent three hours in Heathrow airport checking in and waiting on line. I was really looking forward to a late birthday dinner with Traci (my best freind), and Willy (someone i thought was one of my close friends). this had all been planned out before i left, for the record. Traci and Willy were to meet at my house before two. They were to go to JFK together, and arrive by 4 (when my flight let out) - and meet me at the gate. Traci and I then, figured, that we would all go out together for drinks and dinner, since i would need to stay awake until at least 12 - so that i could get back to the US time zone, and hopefully make it into work on time monday. Of course none of this did actaully happen. Willy never called Traci. He blew her off, and instead of bringing her to get me, he decided to bring Wreak. (not that i didn't want to see wreak, it's just i know that those two are a timb bomb waiting to happen, when it comes to keeping to a schedule). Anyway, sice traci could not call them, she IM'd Wreak at around 4:30 - and wreak then explained to her that Willy did not have "time" to meet her - so he was on the way to Wreak's house. This was at 4:30. Traci did not see Wreak sign off until 5, which is when i assume Willy got to his house - since they arrived at JFK together). As always, sunday's on the Belt parkway are a traffic disaster waiting to happen. They must have been in bumper to bumper traffic for at least 2 and a half hours, sice they did not arrive at the airport to get me, until nearly 8PM. I feel the need to mention that the plane ride hoem has a lot of turbulance, i had PMS, and i had not had a moments rest the entire time i was in England) Anyway, when they got there (without my best friend who i was dying to see), FOUR hours after I had gotten off the plane, i was in tears. I was also angry, dissapointed, and rude - without a doubt. In any event, Willy did much less than apologize. He didnt say one word all the way back to my house, and then he left. All this would not bother me a bit, if i did not lay myself on the line and get him a job at my office. Now i have to go there every day and be ignored by a person that completely fucked me over and doesn't even have the decency to apologize. The part that bothers me the most is, I wasn't even mad the next day. I figured it wasn't intentional, I was over sensitive, and that was that. I never expected him to be such a baby. really. well, anyway - while initially i was all about letting bye-gones be bye-gones - now i'm not so sure. All the times that i sat there and listened to him complain and yell about how badly certain people had fucked him over. Letting him stay at my house for days on end, so that he would not feel alone. getting him a job at my office, because i knew he needed one. All that, and he fucks me over. And on top of that, I let it go - and he continues to be a complete asshole, without even offering an apology. You know - the only thing worse than being alone is having fake ass friends. The sad part that is even if he was to realize what a dick he has been., he's already terminated our friendship. Well at least my being friends with him, because now it's obvious that he was never being freinds with me. oh well...at least i know now, before i put myself on the line anymore for this one...

life never ceases to amaze me. today it's been brought to light that, possibly , one of my good friends is afraid to date someone that i used to see, in fear that i would be mad. usually i'd appreciate that sort of thing, but in this case it makes little to no sense. for once in my life (and i think that it may actually be the first time), i am so completely "in like" with someone, that neither the past or future emotions are interesting me in the least. i'd like for my friends to be happy. i know that a lot of people say things like that, but i actually mean it. if one of my friends likes someone that i was involved with at one time, i would not have any problem with them seeing each other. i mean, shit doesn't work out sometimes. that doesn't mean that the other party involved isn't deserving of happiness! the idea of "jealousy" has always offended me to a degree. no one owns anyone. if one is oh-so-concerned with the happiness and well being of those they care about, why would they let selfishness come between themselves, their lover, their ex lover, or their friends? i can't answer that really, because i think it's completely rediculous. that's not to say that i don't appreciate that other people have those feelings, because i do. i would never hook up with someone if i knew that it would upset one of my friends, but at the same time - i kind of expect the people that i consider to be my friends to just know better than to expect that sort of behavior from me. ugh. hopefully i've cleared all of this up for them tonight. kids, i'm all for it. and i hope that when you kiss each other, and look into each others eyes that you have the very same feeling i do when i'm with my.. well, whatever he is. let's just call him "that guy that makes jenna's knees buckle". right now i'm thinking about this *thing* that happened not too long ago. actually, it was the night after the i was cured event in brooklyn. Traci and i met up with this guy Jimmy, who i was seeing (i think) at the time. i didn't know him all that well, but i liked him. well, maybe i just respected him, and was slightly intrigued by his intelligence and conversational skills - but in any event - we ended up at his place towards the end of the night. I drank way too much, and was confused. We fell asleep, and woke up to find that there was a small accident, and traci got a dime sized spot of blood (from a piercing) on his bed. He really made a huge deal out of it, and Traci felt absolutely awful. The whole thing brought me into tears, and after the whole crazy night - it just didn't "click" inside of my head, as to what was really upsetting me. initially i blamed the tears on the fear that he was "mad" at me, or something to that effect. for the next few days i felt awful (once again, not really understanding why). It all ended in a conversation, in which he (more or less) told me that we'd be better off going our seperate ways. during that conversation, i tried to fight it - and lost. but deep down in my heart i knew something was wrong, and i never did call him again. (in fact i deleted his number out of my phone, and burned the paper i had with his number on it, haha) it took some time, but i realized something that changed me. first of all, i realized that he was right - it was better off that we didn't see each other any more. but, more importantly, i realized why i was so upset that night, to begin with. what made me cry like that. It wasn't so much that i was afraid that he was "mad" at me - it was the fact that he treated my friend like that, and made her feel that awful in front of me. It was, that because something "grossed him out", he let two girls (who he knew had drank entirely too much) drive home in the middle of the night, because he couldn't "emotionally handle" an accident. Had this never happened, and had he not made the suggestion that we were not to hang out "for a while", i know that i would have came to that same conclusion on my own - once the shock wore off. It's funny how things like that happen, really. Incidentally, the very next day, I met Chris at a bookstore - and Chris is the one who is teaching me about the way a man is supposed to treat a woman (and her friends, hehe) - which sadly enough, i never knew a thing about (needless to say, i've been swept off my feet - and we haven't been apart for more than a few days, since the moment we met - minus the two trips to europe we've taken this month, lol) I guess some would call this fate... (when one door shuts, another one opens - and sometimes it takes you to a much more wonderful place!) the best part of this whole experience is that if somehow things were not to work out between us, i'd be ok with that, and i'd still (and always) want to be his friend. i mean, of course i'd be sad and dissapointed - because this all feels so good - but he has taught me so much about what i want and how i want to be treated. i am so greatful for that. i will always want him to be happy, even if it's not with me. shit, even if it's with one of my friends! he has taught me that i'd rather live alone in casa blanca, than with or without someone in a state discomfort, fear, or jealousy. (note: i really should have learned this before Will passed away, but maybe i was just too young to understand, or even appreciate the comfort level and mutual respect in our relationship) the not-so-point of all this is that my friends and their happiness come first. mine will always follow. although sometimes it takes a little while to realize this and act upon it, it always holds true. I want both of the "friends" i spoke of before to be happy. I want Jimmy to be happy. I want Traci to be happy. Shit, and the same goes for all of you. REALLY. you deserve it. just follow your heart. at the end of the day i did, and i've never felt so complete. Love You All -Jenna (the rambling queen)

life is pretty some days. today is my last "official" day of work, until 6/22. This will be, by far, the longest time i've been out of the office since i'm thirteen years old. I got my passport in the mail today, from amerian passport . I was starting to get sacred that it wasn't coming, because i sent them all of the information / requirements last friday, and they claim that there is a 24 hour turn around. Although it took over four business days, I'm still pleased with their service - because I have my passport in hand, and i didn't have to go into the city to get it. Last night was kick ass. Julie and Traci took me out to dinner at Nonna's. It's a beautiful Italian restaurant next to my office. We had an incredible bottle of wine, a delicious dinner, and a hot waiter. haha. there was even a guy with a guitar there that sang happy birthday to me. In return I asked him to sing a song for Julie, so she wouldn't feel left out. haha so he changed the song "Hey Jude" into "Hey Julie".. and sang the whole thing. It was fucking hilarious. After that, we went back to my place and watched Casa Blanca. Then, Chris came over =). He stayed for a few hours, which (as always) made me a very happy girl. He is so good to me! Ugh, i am so lucky to have met this one. I really like him a lot. And I realize it more and more every day. I know i keep saying that, but it's true. And of course i can't tell him all this, so I'll tell you! Ok, so three days until London. I still haven't packed, or even bought most of the shit I'll need - but I figure after work traci will go shopping with me and i'll get a lot of that accomplished. I'm keeping my fingers crossed that I'll get to see Chris while I'm in London, since he'll be around there doing his thing at the same time. I'm not counting on it though, since we only have a two day overlap - and then I leave for home. We'll see though. A girl can hope, can't she... Other amazing things happened yesterday as well at work, but I'm not going to go into it here. Let's just say that for the first time, in a really long time, i feel appreciated. Oh yeah, and today when i came into the office, my desk was covered in hello kitty gear, balloons, and birthday cards!! It was so sweet! My colleagues are the absolute best! alright, enough of my happy-babbles. time to do some work! xo

GEMINI (May 21-June 20): You're in a phase when you may be tempted to start food fights at fancy dinner parties, wrap toilet paper around the trees in front of your adversaries' houses, and regard the juvenile delinquents of cable TV's South Park as worthy role models. I hate to discourage you from indulging this instinct for uproar, since so much of it could be fun and liberating. Therefore, I'm going to authorize you to go right ahead. But keep a fraction of your adult brain working in the background, ready to step in and halt the proceedings if you're ever about to, say, imitate the South Park kids' "How to eat with your butt" routine for your boss. hehe!

ugh. what a weekend. i am so exhausted, it's not even funny. friday night rahim, shamrock, and i went to NYC to hang out. we landed at Manitoba's, and didn't get home until like 5 in the morning. the den of degridation. awh yeah. i couldn't go to sleep, because i had to get rahim home by 11, so that he could babysit his neice. we basically made it there on time, and then i dropped shamrock off at home, and went home to sleep. i slept the whole damn day, and night. willy and wreak came over at some point, but i was basically passed out the whole night. they crashed at my house, and sunday we went to the flea market and stuff. then, brian decided to show up at my house, without calling first. i was so mad, not at him really - just at the situation in general, since i had to leave right after he got there. i hate when people just "show up" at my house, without calling. it's a pet peeve. anyway. the night ended up all crazy, and willy and i didn't get back to my house until 3 in the morning. it's a good thing he slept over, because i NEVER would have made it to work this morning if he didn't wake my ass up. now i'm rotting at my desk, thinking about all the things i didn't get done this weekend. i leave for London in 6 days, and i haven't even done my shopping yet. ugh! i am such a lazy bastard sometimes. anyway, i guess i'm going to try to get some work done. i hope that i get to see chris tonight. i wanted to visit him last night, but didn't get home until too late. no fun at all. you know what i'm realizing? i like this boy. i really do. it's wierd. my usual trend is to start off liking someone a lot, and then as i get to know them, i become less and less interested. this is such a twist for me, because i like him so much more now, than i did when i met him. initially i was completely terrified of liking him, and now i feel so comfortable with all this. it's really cute. heh, ok - i'm being a dork. just deal with it.

alright. so what if i could have things my way. what would i want then? i'd want to move back home. i know that must sound stupid, because i grew up only an hour and a half from here. but, that's where i'd go. i miss my friends. i miss knowing where the best grocery store is. i miss knowing what shelf the sci fi books are on, at the local book store. i miss running into my old teachers at the coffee shop. i... i'd want to go back to school. yes, i know i AM going back to school soon - but that's not my school. i'd want to go back to FDU. everyone that goes there hates it, i know. but, i didn't. i grew there. and when my dad got sick, and i had to leave, i left a part of myself there - that i really want back. i... i'd want to go into a business where i felt utilized. i'm not saying that i'd want to leave the industry, because i know it, and some even say that i was born to be in it. i'd just want to be somewhere that what i did was accredited to me. not that i'd help my parents any less, but there's something degrading about working to take care of people, and getting no real credit. and even worse, it hurts to work so hard and have it written off to the people around you as something you should be doing to pay off your parents debt. i... i'd want to not care so much about the people around me. i'd want to NOT worry about things and people's well being, especially when they, themselves, are not worried about it. i .... i'd want to feel wanted, but not out of necessity. i'd want to stop being so emotional. to stop hurting like this over things i have no control over. i'd want to stop day dreaming about the life i know damn well i'll never have. less realistically, i'd want my dad to be healthy again. i'd want my mom to live the life she used to have. i'd want my sister to be happy, at any and all costs. i'd want us to not have to struggle so much, for things that we never had to blink an eye over. i'd want well.. everything i used to have.... except, this time i'd actually appreciate it.

why doesn't this feeling go away? i don't understand myself. all i want to do is accept where i am, and learn to live with it in peace. why can't i just do that. i'm tired of feeling like this. i'm tired of living so far from my friends. i'm tired of always having to be the strong one. i'm tired of telling people everything is going to "be ok", when everything in my world is so far from "ok". i'm tired of coming in last. but most of all, i'm tired of crying about it all.

still haven't eaten. i'm not sure if the way i'm feeling is a result of low blood sugar, or simply a lack of distraction. work has been hectic. i still feel like i don't belong there. i miss my father. god, i just miss my life.

now onward with the entry and comments. i have decided that goal of this website is now to help me make sense of my life. so many things have happened to me, so many events have unwound in ways that seem bizarre and otherworldly that i need to find some sense of stable reasoning in order to live. i've been plunging into my archives, trying to figure out what the hell happened, now that I have a little more objectivity. i've realized that my really spastic year and "nervous breakdown" did not come out of the blue. there was definitely some ominous foreshadowing. my desire to be torn open, my sense that something was coming was all there and .....

sometimes things are different than they seem. tonight, i spent the evening with my mother. i took her out to dinner at this really nice cafe, in freehold. it was one of those byob places, so of course, i did. after we finished a bottle of 97 ruffino, she started talking. i really don't feel comfortable talking about what was said, but let's just say that i have a very different view ablout life (in general) after tonight. there are so many different emotions bouncing around inside me like erratic quarks. i'm lost, i'm hopeful, i'm sad, i'm happy, i'm safe, and i'm scared and i'm angry... i can see how possible it would be for things to turn around but i almost don't expect them to. i don't expect things to go right. but haven't i paid my dues by now? i know i had debts and pain and guilt to own up to... but when does the self-crucifixion end? i need to forgive myself but i don't think i can do that until i forgive him and he forgives me. and he's dying. slowly, painfuly, and currently. with the time frame, none of this might never happen. and that makes me sick. g-d, i love my mom. but, sometimes, her presence makes me feel like less than a person. it feels like it's about to rain. it feels cool and wet, not humid. there's a breeze coming through the screen of the open window. this is the first time i've opened it in ages. waiting is such a funny thing. especially when the span of time is not a defined thing. it could end/begin tonight, abrupt as a sudden corner. or it could distend into weeks. i don't know. maybe years. after a while it almost doesn't seem like there will be an end/beginning- and it doesn't seem real that it will actually happen. (maybe that's a side effect of sitting in an emotional coma for a year.) i'm edgy. i'm jumpy. i'm crouched at the starting line, trying not to jump the gun, but desperate to have that first foot hit the ground. i'm also afraid. i know what I want but- it almost doesn't seem real that I might actually get it. i have no doubts but- i'm afraid to hope or believe too much. i have a lot of guilt and sometimes it warps my optimism. is this all stupid? if it wasn't so hard to figure out where i stood, would i even care? i think that i would - but then again, i think a lot of things... i don't deserve this anyway. i never gave anyone what they wanted. why would i... blech. so be it.

you know what I really have a very low threshold of tolerance for? judgmental people. with self-righteous people coming in at a close second. and people who are both? forget it. (i'm intolerant of intolerance. ooh, the irony.) not that I'm advocating moral plasticity. on the contrary, i believe in absolute right and wrong. but I also believe that the world is a complex proposition with a thousand shades and gradations in between black and white. take any controversial issue today. people divide themselves down these lines, into these polarized little factions, and then expect you to have a cut and dry opinion on the matter on the tip of your tongue. well, i don't always. not every ideological position can (or should) be summed up in less than 5 words. sometimes the issue, and reasoning behind the position is just a little more complex. similarly, it is not accurate or right to think you can infer very much about anyone on the basis of a few second-hand facts. in a personality psychology class i took a few years ago, i think we call that "L-data," information about a person such as their marital status, their health history, their income. the problem with L Data is that "they are sometimes not even slightly informative about psychological attributes" and "are affected by too many other things to tell us much." (Funder) i think most people would consider themselves basically "good" people, and i'm no different. but i'm making it a point in my life to be very conscious of the choices i make, and to take responsibility for them. i have no problem owning up to my mistakes and faults and calling them what they are. but when someone steps in and decides to start judging, labelling and condemning me on the basis of a very limited number of facts and almost no context, i get a little pissed off. i don't appreciate being dismissed, particularly in my capacity as an intelligent, moral, and responsible person. i believe that guilt is not often a very useful emotion, and that regret is utterly so. so I have no apologies to make for myself or the way i approach my life. i feel better having said that.

i am not feeling entirely coherent this evening, because i have a lot going on in my world. i'm going to try to blog anyway, simply because sometimes it's impossible for me to organize my thoughts without seeing them written down. yesterday was a little complicated. i don't really feel like getting into detail, but let's just say that once again i have assumed responsibility for something that has absolutely nothing to do with me. towards the end of the night, after a lot of thinking and crying, i got a chance to speak with chris on the phone. as usual, hearing his voice made all of my problems feel tiny. he really has a knack for doing that. it amazes me every time. this morning i didn't want to get out of bed, but i did. i made it into the office a few minutes after nine, and tried to get some work done. unfortunately, the majority of my morning was actually spent in conversations with my lawyer and my mother. once again, some debt that my parents had from when my father became ill had resurfaced. thankfully, i managed to make a reasonable deal with the attorney handling the collections end of things. i left the office and brought him a certified check for $2000., which will supposedly end the proceedings against my family. the bad news is that the total amount i'm going to have to pay for them is over $18,000. the good news is that the lawyer helped me get a very reasonable payment schedule - and it should all be taken care of fairly quickly. after i took care of that whole mess, i asked my mother to meet me at my place for lunch. i picked up some bagels and we had a talk about the meeting i had been to earler. she must have apologized over a hundred times. i don't know what in the world would make her think she has to apologize to me for my father getting sick, but she does. constantly. in my opinion my father's illness has nothing to do with the fact that my family expects me to take on the roll he once played in our family, but i guess i'll save that part for another day. in any event, the whole situation sucks, but the part that bothers me most is that sometimes i let myself feel awful about it. sometimes i wish that i wasn't smart enough to know that nothing can make a person feel sad. if anything, we merely allow ourselves to focus on negative things, and ignore or neglect the good ones. lately when i start to feel sad, i try to remember that. i try to remind myself that whatever problem is at hand - is nothing compared to all of the good things in my life. i'm not great at convincing myself at times, but admittedly - i'm getting much better. and that makes me feel more in control of my life. this, obviously, can not be a bad thing. anyhow, back to my day. after all of the jewish guilt layed on me by good old mom, i went back to the office to pick up some sex pistols tickets for the show tonight at jones beach. (a gift from a business associate/friend of my partners). i worked for a little while, and then headed out to jersey city to pick up rick - who was kind enough to come with me to the show. the ride was fucking tedious, and all i could think about is starting a massive forest fire. (yes i know, i'm going to hell) anyhow, we eventually made it there - and as soon as we got out of my car we realized that i was the third to yougest person in the whole fucking place! the parking lot and venue were both filled with the scum of the earth. ordinarily, this might have made me feel slightly uncomfortable, but watching rick ridecule every single washed up dirt bag that passed by us sure eased the situation. haha. we got to catch most of the dropkick murphys performance (which was alright, considering neither of us knew more than one song they played during the entire set). of course watching the sex pistols afterwards was a total fucking riot. Johnny Rotten was wearing bright pink jams and a flourescent yellow tank top. As far as i was concerned, seeing him in that outfit was well worth the drive! haha. in all honesty, they sounded decent for a bunch of old guys that have no desire, other than financial, to be performing. In my opinion, the most upsetting thing about the entire show, was the people there to watch! i mean, REALLY. half of them bought out hot topic last night just so they'd look "cool". The other half had on freshly purchased tank tops over their button down shirts. nausiating, i tell you! i swear, if rick didn't have such a fucking amazing sense of humor, and managed to make fun of (loudly), every single person that came within a ten foot radius of us, i think i would have been completely depressed by the entire scene. i swear to you - there were fifteen year old girls dancing like they were trying out for the movie FAME in the aisles, beavis and butthead looking characters making "metal" signs in the stands, old guys that probably couldn't even hear the music because they had their hearing aids on mute, and ladies that looked like they just stepped out of the filming of footloose. (not to mention the prince-on-crack look alike and his disgusting wife that danced like a bunch of violently ill retards through the entiire show). ugh i could go on and on... but for your sake i won't. haha. anyway, being as PUNK as possible, the sex pistols ended their set at 10PM. haha can you believe that???? for me, that was the punchline. so anyhow, rick and i headed back to jersey. while we were on the way i spoke to thealphamale. sadly, it turns out he won't be back home until tuesday. for some reason i had been thinking it was monday all week long, so now i have to add another 1440 minutes onto my stop watch. *sniffle* i am so pathetic sometimes. when he told me i swear i almost started to cry! haha. i mean, i need to teach my emotions about logic. it's one day for christ sake! apparently, my heart has never wanted so badly to be with someone! all in all, it's a good thing though. the fact that 24 more hours of no chris bummed me out so badly, only goes to show how much i miss him. the whole situation will be easily fixed anyhow. i just have to stop into the office tomorrow and let everyone know i will be in on monday, just not tuesday... christ. i really am so excited. there's nothing in the entire world i want, more than to wrap my arms around this man again and give him a giant kiss. nothing, i tell you. nothing! anyway, now that i'm half way through with writing a fucking novel, i think i'll shut the hell up. tomorrow traci and i are heading out to washington DC for the tattoo convention, and i haven't even begun to pack! have no worries though, i'm bringing the good old laptop, as usual - so you'll have plenty of pictures to gawk at soon. lesigh. the sad part about stopping this entry now, is that i could go on and on.... haha. $20 says this will not be my only post tonight. three more days four more days

today was one of those days in which nothing went the right way. last night an extremely disturbing dream. in it, chris invited traci and i to meet him at some venue. we drove for, what seemed to be, an eternity. finally we arived at a huge warehouse type building. we parked the car, and then walked in. everywhere we went, i found groups of friends. everyone had seen him, and pointed to where i could find him. we walked and walked - from room to room. always to find more friends that just saw him - bit we never found him. it felt as though i had looked in five hundred rooms and fifty hallways. always finding more friends, but never finding him. this dream must have lasted five hours. finally my alarm went off, and i woke up. bummed as ever. all i wanted to do was go back to sleep, just so i could see him. but, i had to go to work - so after a half hour of deliberation - i got in the shower. i arrived at work about a half hour late. i worked as hard as i possibly could. i got some bad news that i don't feel like getting into - but the result is that, once again, i am taking responsibility for my parents debt. this time it will cost me nearly $18,000. i'll be paying it off in september - and since it will more or less clean me out - it looks like i won't be able to continue my masters degree for a while.. when i got home, my mom must have called me five times apologizing to me and crying. as always, i told her not to worry. (that's my job anyway, right?) sigh. aftr the fifth call i managed to convince her everything was ok, and i needed some sleep, so i'd call her tomorrow. so, she didnt call me again tonight. which resulted in me finding out that my dad went into the hospital again tonight, from someone else. i can't get any answer on the phone, and i don't know where he is or what happened... i don't know what else to say. i'm not thinking clearly right now. traci and julie are here with me, trying to keep me sane as always. i'm really lucky to have friends like this, that's for sure. i hope these next few days pass quickly. i know once chris wraps those arms of his around me again, my problems will seem so small. i guess that's the beauty in being in love. or part of it at least. even with him being so far away, just knowing that he cares, and having him in my heart makes everything bearable. so even after my sob story, i still recognize that i am the luckiest girl in the world. and for that, i'm greatful as can be... 5 more days .

urlLink Tisha B'Av: I've got some good news and some bad news... . "The good news: You've just escaped with your lives and My help from Egypt. The bad news: I'm not going to let you into Canaan, the promised land, the land of milk and honey. Instead you're going to wander in the desert for forty years, dying until you are all gone. Dead. Sleeping with the fishes. No Canaan for you. The good news: I'll let your children in. But not you." Today is Tisha b'Av (the 9th day of Av), the anniversary of the day God broke this news to the Jews. a lot of other stuff happened to us on this day too : -the holy temples in Jerusalem were destroyed (the western wall, "wailing wall" to some, is the last part standing) -Betar, the last fortress to hold out against the Romans during the Bar Kochba revolt in the year 135, fell, sealing the fate of the Jewish people. -the children of israel who left egypt were told by hashem that they would not be permitted to enter the land of Israel . -the jews were expelled from Spain in 1492, part of the Spanish Inquisition. (not to mention that Wold War I, which began the downward slide toward the holocaust, is also said to have begun on Tisha b'av as well) so, today is the Jewish fast day of Tisha B'av AKA the "black fast day", and to sum it up, this day represents pretty much every bad event in Jewish history. it is a universal day of mourning. (and fasting, which admittedly, i never do) i understand that Tisha B'av is an integral part of the Jewish calendar--and it's of enormous importance to most of us. i have been taught that judaism is in unique in that mourning is honorable, and not something to shy away from. everything in our lives is often positive (from a religious aspect), and we rarely set aside time to mourn, to lament, and to ponder the bad that is in the world. we rarely do so, and i encourage everyone to take a few moments, regardless of your religion, and contemplate what it means to mourn. mourning is both positive and negative. think about it. -this public service announcement has been provided by everyone's favorite tattood jew AKA girl138.

tonight was so much fun. hehe! after work i met up with the alpha male at his house, and we went to the outback to have dinner with his mom. she is so cool! i only got to meet her once before (over the weekend) - but the more i hear her speak, the more i like her. she is so well spoken and funny! plus, you can just see how much she loves him (and what a great relationship they have) when they converse. it made the little hairs on the back of my neck stand up! also, i just think it's so kind of her to let me tag-along with them. it was such a great dinner! god, i love listening to him talk.... eep. anyhow, after dinner, i decided to stop at the hospital to see my dad. usually that place really upsets me, but i couldn't do anything but smile after the dinner i had just had. my father and i discussed the family, the hospital, and the usual work issues - but then he said something, well, out of the ordinary. it would be impossibe to repeat the entire conversation, because he's so sick and hard to understand, so i'll just write about the parts i fully understood: (obviously omitting the things i didn't understand and the "what daddy, please say that again" 's ...) dad : so how's the boy me : he's amazing dad dad : i can tell ...your sparkle is back me : what? hehe! dad : your sparkle! me : i didn't know i lost it to begin with dad : you used to have it when you were little me : gee thanks dad dad : i mean you look happy like you used to be before i got like this me : dad you don't make me sad! dad : so, you're in love, huh me : what? (i'm thinking, he's accused me of a lot of things in my day, but never this one, i must be hearing wrong) dad : i said you're in love princess old black dude in neighboring hospital bed : she sure does look like a lady in love (he smiles at me) me : oh my god. dad, youre making me want to climb under your bed! stop it! dad : you won't fit under all this metal shit (he laughs) me : (blushing) dad, you're crazy! cmonnnnnnnnnnn! stop youre making me blush! dad : (looks at the old black dude) tell me i'm crazy old black dude : no sir, i think i agree. she is glowing. and blushing! (he laughs) me : what's all this shit about my eyes? are you guys are on drugs? (i realize this was a dumb question) dad : DUH jennifer. i still think you're in fucking love! (he laughs at me) me : (blushes again) that's it. i'm getting out of here. you old farts are making me insane! dad : i love you - princess. and i'm happy to see your eyes sparkling again. i like him already. oh, and tell your mom to bring me some real food tomorrow. it sucks here. bye. i love you.... me : i'll tell her daddy. and thanks. and i love you too... old black dude : goodnight beautiful! (i give them both a kiss, and then leave) i've been looking in a morror for the last half hour. and honestly, my eyes are looking a little brighter than usual. hmm....

La Vita Nuova "in that book which is my memory . . . on the first page (that is the chapter when i first met you) appear the words . . . 'here begins a new life'" i discovered this quote thanks to an episode of star trek voyager (which might have misquoted it). according to voyager, the book opens like this: in that book which is my memory, on the first page of the chapter that is the day when I first met you appear the words: here begins a new life. those words are, admittedly, quite beautiful. it was on their merit alone that I went out to find the book. it's a description of how meeting someone can turn you into someone new and make everything that came before seem meaningless. unfortunately the true opening of the book (according to a 1969 translation by Barbara Reynolds) is not even remotely about beatrice, or even love. she translates it as: "in the book of my memory, after the first pages, which are almost blank, there is a section headed 'Incipit vita nova'. beneath this heading i find the words which it is my intention to copy into this smaller book, or if not all, at least their meaning." it's still a lovely group of words, but a little disappointing in comparison. anyway, i prefer the voyager version over barbara's translation of urlLink dante 's - so i'm leaving it above, as is. because that's just how i feel right now.

I wonder if Chris would like urlLink any urlLink of urlLink this urlLink stuff .. I'm coming to terms with the fact that none of my furniture is going to match any of his. this leaves us with two options. we can have a lof of stuff that looks awful together or we can pick out some new furniture together that blends in with what he already has. of course, i'm voting for option #2. It's not that he has awful furniture or anything, but i think i'll just feel a little more comfortable if we had just a few things that were ours. not just his, ya know? God, this is a really dumb thing to be consumed with during the work day. haha. I just don't know how to say what I am feeling right now. Of course, this is nothing new to me. Maybe I shouldn't even be typing this, but I don't know what else to do. I need to make sense of things to myself, I think. I have some beautiful things that I love. A lot of them I am willing to part with. He is worth it and I would give up anything, without hesitation, to be with him. Unfortunately, that doesn't make certain things any easier. I have to find new homes for my cats. Avery and Persia aren't going to be nearly as difficult to part with as Lily. For the last month or so, I have been going to my apartment to visit them on my lunch breaks. Lily knows I am gone, and she is mad at me. I can tell. She used to be SO affectionate towards me before all of this. Now she looks at me and thinks "you're a bad mommy. you left me". She's just a cat. I love her like she's my baby, but the reality of it is that I can't bring her with me. It's not an option. And even though I want to tear my hair out when I think about it, I know giving her away is the right thing to do, for all of us. sigh. Last november I bought a dining room table. This doesn't sound very exciting, does it? Well, for me - It was a landmark. I think It was the first "adult purchase" I ever made. And I was so proud of myself. It's not that it's the most expensive or beautiful thing in the world, but it made me feel at home. Shortly after, my mom gave me a china cabinet that I had been dying to get my hands on since I was a child. We had it in our home since I was born. I loved it so much that I decorated my house around the idea of getting it. I found matching persian rugs, sofas, and everything. I love that room. I really do. This is so dumb! I am about to cry over a china cabinet! Okay. I guess the point of all this is, that I want to be able to do it again. To feel connected. I am accepting the fact that the home I created is not my home anymore. And I wouldn't want it to be. Not without Chris. Nothing I have matches his house at all, or would even so much as function in it. (with all the traffic and three giant dogs). I just want to make it feel like my home too, with him. I want to look around and feel like I am a part of something there. Even if it's something as silly as a coffee table. or a dresser. I don't want to change anything that Chris is happy with. In fact, I want to do the opposite. I want us both to love this house and everything in it. And each other. Forever. I am not sure that any of this made sense. I hate being female some days.

Rosh Hashanah literally means "head of the year". Just as the head leads the body, our actions on Rosh Hashanah set the tone for the New Year, embodying the potential for life, blessing and sustenance for the coming year. For this reason we are especially mindful of all we think, say and do during these two special days. Our wish for you in this coming year is reflected in the words of the first night of Rosh Hashanah, L'shanah tovah tikatiev v'techatem: "May you be written and inscribed for a good and bountiful year." As of last week, about 1,600 Americans have been trapped in the labyrinth of the U.S. legal system by a body that, though it has no public accountability, has established itself as a quasi-governmental authority. Torn away from their lives, they face massive fines, court costs, and even imprisonment. Were these people terrorists? Pedophiles? Hapless under-employed twenty-somethings who had defaulted on their student loans? Nope: They were ordinary computer users charged by the Recording Industry of America with violating the Digital Millennium Copyright Act. While it was urlLink originally instituted in 1998 as part of the hardly publicly-minded World Trade Organization's mandates for member countries , the DMCA is one step closer to actually handing the country over to corporate rule. (Lest we forget, the government is currently the sole property of urlLink Halliburton .) For instance, the Act gives the recording industry, which is a trade group and not something that anyone actually voted on, essentially Gestapo-like powers. Rather than the subpoena being given by an actual judge, it can be issued by the clerk of a United States District Court upon reasonable suspicion that you're hooked up to a peer-to-peer network such as WinMX or KaZaA. Bamyour ISP has to provide all your information, including your name, address, telephone number, shoe size, and whether or not you wank to the girls jumping on trampolines during the "Man Show" credits. And, if they find any music files after they confiscate your hard drive, you'll most likely be their indentured servant for the rest of your natural life, with a large chunk of your wages garnished to pay off the "damages." For a trade group to wield that kind of influence is ridiculous. Hell, Ralph Nader wishes he had that kind of pull. Moreover, the entire argument that the recording industry uses to defend its actionsthat it protects artists' rightsis patently ridiculous. Music today is an industry; songs and "artists" are manufactured the way Andy Warhol manufactured silkscreens and the Velvet Underground. To suggest that Creed or Avril Lavigne or Justin Timberlake or some other assembly-line device for branding sound is having the fruits of their labors ripped off by file-swapping script kiddies is like suggesting that Milli Vanilli is getting ripped off every time someone fires up a karaoke machine. Through the magic of marketing, the recording industry has made something otherwise worthless into a precious commodity, restricted public access to it by making the prices ridiculously high (have you seen what they're charging for CDs these days?!), and then screaming bloody murder when a black market develops. What the RIAA is really afraid of is that file sharing is destroying this little racket they've got going. Historically, the recording industry got huge at the same time that people moved from the shoulder-to-shoulder crowding cities to the bland anonymity of the suburbslimiting their access to live music venues and other sources of authentic culture, but opening the door for the culture-manufacturing industry to step in and provide us with an amazing simulation thereof, just the same way that Wonder Bread and Spam are amazing simulations of actual food. What the Internet has done is digitally reconnect us into communities, short-circuiting the means of marketing, manufacture, and distribution that the powers that be have invested so much in. The RIAA, a dinosaur if there ever was one, knows it's fighting a losing battle against the forces of evolution. Sure, CD sales have declined, but when you consider the lawyers' fees and work hours necessary to indict, convict, and fine even a tiny portion of the people who are swapping files, they're just throwing good money after bad. Like the vicious dog in your neighbor's fenced-in yard, the RIAA is dangerous, but sufficiently remote not to be worrisome to the vast majority of people. And they know it: Take, for example, their recent motions towards urlLink persuading Congress that P2P networks are a one-stop source for computer viruses and kiddie porn . Next thing they'll do is require you to pay royalties if you get a song stuck in your head or you sing "Happy Birthday" at someone's party. (Someone actually owns the rights to "Happy Birthday," you know.) What's even more wrong is for a private entity to hijack the courts and ruin the lives of a small portion of the people who are threatening its imagined hegemony. The way to stop it is by the power of the purse. I, for one, urlLink will not buy another freaking CD put out by a major label until the charges against every one of the people indicted under the DCMA are dropped. Maybe then they'll finally shut the fuck up and die. (Incidentally, I, personally, don't use peer-to-peer networks, simply because what's out there is crap. Do a search for some of the people who've authored half the mp3s on my hard drive, and you're going to get zilch. People made music for millennia before Thomas Edison ever made a wax cylinder, and the survivors huddled in the ruins of our current civilization will continue doing it, at least until the toxic zombies eat their brains. And if I ever meet Lou Reed or Jello Biafra, I'll be sure to slip them a twenty for whatever transgressions the Internet community at large has committed.) Disco sucks.

Sometimes I say things just so that no one else can say anything during that brief moment while I'm speaking. I'll say something outrageous about myself or something strange that I heard just to get the people I'm with to stop and think and loose track of what they were going on about before I changed the subject. What I say isn't any less true or meaningful than what they were talking about because all anyone talks about is other people or things they heard that are probably not true either. It's not as if I enjoy hearing myself talk or think that what I say is important, because having people listen to me usually embarrasses me like crazy. It's just that I get sick of hearing other people go on and on. I like people who say little, but what they say means a lot. People who can't stop talking tire my ears and I begin to block them out, then feel like I'd do anything for a second silence while they stopped and pondered, but they don't, they just keep going without even breathing and their rate accelerates and their pitch gets slowly but steadily more exited, and I begin to get tense, I realize I'm tense so consciously relax but they are still going on and on, and what they are talking about (when I can concentrate on the actual words this long) is about how much other people suck or the world sucks or how much better they are than something and I can not bear to hear such bullshit so try to say something with out being rude and finally there is a breath of silence so I say the first thing that comes to mind. I don't say weird things on purpose and I never lie, but sometimes I say things that I don't know are true, because I've only heard them. That, I usually feel bad about later, especially if I find out it is not true. I think of that as spam. Passing false information is like forwarding an email message that is a hoax, but worse actually, because it is passed from brain to brain. An email message has less of a chance of actually being read and entered into the brain. Me saying something is probably more likely to be heard and believed and passed on, well maybe not with my reputation for saying strange things. Maybe I'm just imagining that though, everyone says shit they heard, and I often know they are repeating bullshit, but when I make a little mistake like that I'm probably just too sensitive about it. I guess I don't much like making mistakes or being wrong. That's probably a problem. Well, what ever, I'm a perfectionist, and one who fucking likes people to shut up sometimes and stop talking shit. Sue me. Sigh. That just about sums up the first half of my day. Eight hours of aggrivation followed by great sex and a yummy "family" dinner. =) pooooooooooooooooooooor me . hehehehhe.

the RIAA is now urlLink raiding independent record stores without warrants , looking to confiscate DJ mix CDs. who loves ya? quick, the ship is sinking! turn the cannons on the lifeboats! the must-read article of the day is urlLink this essay by George Ziemann at MP3 Newswire. Ziemann outlines how the music industry is repeating all of Thomas Edison's monopolistic mistakes from the early days of the film industry. This particular line jumps out at me: Step 6 -- Alienate the public Edison did his best to squash his competitors, but he never stooped so low as to try suing moviegoers for attending "unlicensed" movies. It share an artist's files freely, you can listen to them 3 times for free, then pay $1 to unlock them. Artists get half and filesharers even get a cut. Uses Microsoft DRM (Digital Rights Management) , but it's still clever enough to deserve a chance.

It's sort of interesting to see the outcome of getting a life. Take on a few home improvement projects, form some friendships "offline", and just breathe in the fresh air from outdoors.. and suddenly you forget that you own a computer.. let alone a website. There are so many people out there who are blogging daily, changing layouts like they do their panties.. and well.. I just don't see how i used to find the time to do it. I lead a pretty calm life, yet I still cannot fathom using so much time and energy for something as silly as this anymore. Classic Jenna Syndrome . If anything becomes 'popular', I bail.. rebel.. run for the hills. Maybe that's the problem?? I've been doing this whole blog thing for years and years.. and now that it's mainstream, eck.. it's suddenly a giant bore. But sadly I'll keep on doing it I imagine. I have one major gripe on my mind today .. cell phones. Why on earth do you people (meaning like 90% of the American population) insist on carting those damn things everywhere??? Must you really talk to your best friend, your aunty, your boyfriend, grandma, cousin Jose.. whatever on a constant basis?? So much that you cannot perform basic functions.. ohh.. like taking a crap without it in your ear, let alone drive a huge lethal weapon such as a motor vehicle. The whole thing makes me want to break shit!!! It's so bad that I have to deal with you people mindlessly running into me at Quick Checkl because you can't be bothered to pay attention while walking. Focus people.. F O C U S!! Do I have a cell?? Yes. Do i use it or even answer it? NO! When I leave the house, it's because I want to get out and interract with people in person, or that I have stuff to do.. I don't need every damn person on the planet calling me. That's what home telephones are for, and voice mail.. answering machines, etc. Call me old fashioned, but sometimes technology really goes overboard. I'd love to be able to drive down the street and not have to be watching every other idiot around me for fear that their phone call will be more important than paying attention to their driving. I'm constantly almost being ran into, run off the street, etc because the moron in the other car is too damn busy talking on the phone. It's disgusting. As for other things, the whole painting thing seems to be turing out well. Not without drama of course, as my painter is a complete wierdo and has a tendency to forget to do what I ask him to do. The bastard painted the ceiling of the living room (which i specifically asked him not to do because a certain stain there has some sentimental value to Rick). Of course the fucker didn't listen and I feel awful about it. Now I'm trying to redecorate and driving the boyfriend crazy because I'm a spoiled brat who likes to look around the hosue and think "gee, that looks nice". crazy, huh? *sighs* Some would call it worrying, obsessing.. whatever.. I call it being smart and knowing what you like. I'm very proud of the fact that we've been working together on this. He has been making every effort possible to make me feel at home and the house looks damn good. I hope he knows how much i appreciate this. After October we'll have one less roomate, a hot tub, wall to wall carpet, and a pretty bed set. Maybe even new sofas. Then I'll feel all at home and comfy. That is, if he doesn't kill me first.

i love this time of year. i was driving around with willy in my urlLink new car on our lunch break. i couldn't help but notice how pretty trees look when they stop growing leaves and drop them all over the floor. this morning we woke up to the sound of six twenty-something guys in overalls romping on the porch. that means that when i get home the walls are going to be all pretty. i am excited to put thigs back where they belong, the house looks so funny with everything in the middle of the rooms. p.s. i have the best boyfriend on the planet.

Sitting down to play, your arms encircle me, your leg nuzzling soft against mine, as I begin to cautiously stroke these keys. Yet not with the caution of fear or concern. A caution that is in awe of the beauty of a moment, a feeling that somehow can't be explained. Something within, that remains so beautiful, so unblemished by the stains of sadness that mark so many. A moment so virginal in it's innocence, yet so raw in it's passion too ... So giving, by it's very existence, so real, you Are, My Love. Unleashing passions long since locked away, and casting caution aside as I let myself feel with you, be with you, all that I am. All that I must be ... A freedom felt so deeply that it can't be released alone my love. A sense of self, that comes into being through this love I hold so deep, so safe. Submissive, yet not selfless, Gentle, yet never bland. This sense of self within me only heightened, by your touch, your smile, your gentle loving eyes ... your deep and Loving heart. Gently pulling the hair away from my face, soft kisses you plant there. Each kiss you place so lovingly leaving deep and primal traces of the man who fires that love so deep, upon this soul that burns for you ... That craves within, this soul, that flies, so far and free, with you Closing my eyes, you are there, as the music we create as one, begins to fill us both with the sounds of the deep, soft music, that only lovers feel. The tune that plays upon my heart with you. Bringing a tear to my eye with it's beauty. You kiss that falling tear. Allowing it to fall, yet not carelessly so. Embracing the tear that falls from the heart of love that beats inside of me, for you My Love. Lips that long to feel and taste the depths of such a love ... A heart that beats in time with yours, and out of love alone. It slowly finds it's space to Be ... A love that knows no bounds, a depth, beyond profound. Worry not my love, these tears that fill me now... They are as deep and as precious, as free flowing, as your loving heart. Soft and steady ... ever present. In each sound that is heard, in every breath taken, in each and every sight seen, you Are, My Love...

Fall has finally arrived, and I love it. It was so cold this morning that I had to put socks on because my toes were so frozen I could barely move them. And I dont mean this happened in the early morning hours before i left for work, nope, on the way from my car to the door of my office! and it was frigid! Even now, as Im sitting at my computer, I have my favorite sweater on. My hands could use some good mittens, or one of Chris's hands, but in the mean time Ill just have to enjoy the crispness in the air. Its the perfect day to find myself addicted to Frank Sinatra again. Todays play list consists of High Hopes, Softly As I Leave You, The Girl Next Door, Come Rain or Come Shine, The Way You Look Tonight, and my new favorite, One For My Baby. Ive been crooning with Ole Blue Eyes ever since I found them on my hard drive this morning. Right now I'm thinking about how I want to go back to London when its chilly, when I can snuggle by the electric fire, bedecked in my fleece pajamas. Ill be able to see my breath as Im walking through the streets. Yeah, I want to go back to London. Especially when it's not 110 degrees and my week isn't packed with business meetings. But now Im convinced that there are other places Id like to go to soon as well. I want to see my breath in Paris, Berlin, Venice, and lots of other lovely places. Im going on a short trip to Puerto Rico with Chris in November, so maybe that will hold up the dam against this urge to travel for a while. As for right now, I think Ill travel across the room to my car. I am hungry. I have skipped lunch almost every day this week so far, so I think I'll force myself to go to now. Wish me luck, Ill need it. If the phone rings again I may never make it... p.s. my assistant is urlLink pretty funny .. p.s.s. Chris approved the bed set. I'm so excited about getting it for *our* room. =)

Happy Thanksgiving Everyone!!! that being said, it's time for the big news.... We are engaged! Yup, it's officially official. Chris and I are going to tie the knot. We'd been taking about it for some time, but nothing really serious - day dreams perhaps. Then, last night (after another one of my stupid hormonal crying fits) he asked me. And of course I said YES! And how could I not? We're talking my best friend here people. The father of the little bean inside my tummy. Some one whose life is more dear to me than my very own. My playmate. My love. My Chris. So sorry ladies, it looks like the perfect man count is down by one now. My bad, but he's mine, so deal with it. I do wish you other girls the best in finding your true love. Just remember: for richer or poorer, in sickness and in health, till death do you part. I'm gonna cheat a little on the last part though as I plan on loving him long after we leave this world. Sigh. Cleatus and I are the luckiest aliens in the galaxy. So there's the symbol. It's something very special to Chris because it belonged to his aunt. From what I know, she wore it around her neck until just before she passed away. She gave it to Chris and told him that he should use it when he wanted to get married, so that she would be a part of his future. his happiness. He was very close to her, and this is something he holds very dear to his heart. He said that he didn't want to have it set without me because he was afraid I wouldn't like what he chose.. so he proposed with it as is. It is so beautiful and it means so much to him. I am so honored that he gave this to me. The thought of it had me crying my eyes out last night. I don't know how i managed to get such an amazing husband-to-be, i really don't. I'll be sure to thank god every second of every day though, believe me.

warning: mood swing ahead.... god damnit. i haven't been able to get more than ten minutes alone time with chris in over a week! it's mostly my fault because i fall asleep early - and i am fucking grumpy anyway, but seriously. there is never a moment there aren't people here. i am hardly going to see him for the next two weeks. *sniffle* we have parental turkey stuff tomorrow, a party here on friday, and then saturday he leaves for tour. this is so shitty. i always used to think it was gay when my friends would decline to do things because they needed alone time with their significant other, and now i completely understand it. i need hugs and attention and stuff! sigh. growing up is lame. and so is feeling like this. emotional, lonely, and far from fun. stupid pregnancy. now i feel like an alien. i need to go out and do something. anything. except i can't think of anything to do. oh joy. thank god my sister is coming friday. at least while everyone is outside in the hot tub or inside getting drunk i won't be all by myself again.

okay - I may have just had a defining moment of weirdness, kind of a weirdness epiphany. Not a weird epiphany - i've had those before and that's a familiar feeling. no, this is one for the ages: so I'm innocently browsing slate and I happen to come across urlLink an article mocking a dog show and i'm chuckling along with the writer's description of the mutant poodle-thing that won best of show when i stumble upon mention of something called a neuticle. now, that could be the bastard stepchild of a neutron and a testicle, so I'm thinking "hey, radioactive gonads - you'd never need a flashlight - it's all good," and I make the mistake of clicking on the link to read more... AAAHHHHHH!!!!!! they're little squishy (like, marshmellow squishy) silicone testicular implants for animals that have been neutered. just so the fuzzy-wuzzy darlings won't have a trauma when they discover they are bereft of extra dangly bits to lick and be despondent at their newfound state and perhaps cast themselves bodily into the garbage can and scatter juicy scraps all about in a cry for psychiatric help. oh yeah, and on one section of the site (i had to read it all, it was like watching a particularly gruesome car accident involving little old ladies, pink poodles and a case of silly string - no, wait, that would be genuinely funny) they actually warn pet owners not to implant neuticles that are larger than the pet's original testicles. to add design insult to injury, the damned site has an intro page of a blue ball bouncing on an invisible (but no doubt cold and unfeeling) glass surface. What's next? mammary gland implants for nursing bitches who, maybe, are feeling inadequate when faced with a squirming litter of hungry pups? They could call them mammicles and you could pop them in the freezer to keep the milk fresh... i'm going to be under my desk, rocking back and forth for a while. Yeah, I think that's best for everyone.

I am having a girl "vibe" by the way, I don't know if I mentioned that.. I guess we will find out soon enough though.... This morning I talked to my coworker about morning sickness and miscarriage. Once I hear that little heartbeat and know there truly is a baby in there I will be ready to tell the world. But I will probably wait until week 12 to be ultra safe! More later... 7 weeks 6 days

mmm. quiet. i cleaned the house and made brisket tonight (after i went grocery shopping and to bed bath & beyond, that is). chris and his friends went to a show, so i have the house to myself. hehe. mmm. it smells like candles right now, and i like it. i was goofy today. i got this strange burst of energy after work. i think i was driving chris insane. oh wait, i know i was. about ten seconds afterwards, i started thinking about the tile on the bathroom floor being cracked, and i actually got sad about it. can you believe this shit? cleatus sure has a sense of humor. chris says that i am "nesting". i honestly had no idea what he was talking about when he said it too, which makes the whole thing even funnier. i looked it up though, and it made me laugh. according to the article i read, i have been "nesting" my entire young adult life. if i go into a real "nesting mode" my fifth month, chris is going to come home from tour one day and find that all of the sinks, carpet, tiles, and countertops have been replaced. then he will kill me. i don't think that it will be as funny as the article suggests, since i wont be alive to laugh about it with him. dear god, please don't make me do that. amen. urlLink Nesting Instinct "Around the fifth month of pregnancy, the "nesting" instinct can set in. This is an uncontrollable urge to clean one's house brought on by a desire to prepare a nest for the new baby, to tie up loose ends of old projects and to organize your world. Females of the animal kingdom are all equipped with this same need. It is a primal instinct. Just as you see birds making their nests, mothers-to-be do exactly the same thing. The act of nesting puts you in control and gives a sense of accomplishment toward birth. You may become a homebody and want to retreat into the comfort of home and familiar company, like a brooding hen. The nesting urge can also be seen as a sign of the onset of labor when it occurs close to 40 weeks of pregnancy. Nesting brings about some unique and seemingly irrational behaviors in pregnant women and all of them experience it differently. Women have reported throwing away perfectly good sheets and towels because they felt the strong need to have "brand new, clean" sheets and towels in their home. They have also reported doing things like taking apart the knobs on kitchen cupboards, just so they could disinfect the screws attached to the knobs. Women have discussed taking on cleaning their entire house, armed with a toothbrush. There seems to be no end to the lengths a nesting mother will go to prepare for her upcoming arrival. This unusual burst of energy is responsible for women ironing anything in the house that couldn't out run them. Being preoccupied with ant killing, squishing them one at a time for weeks on end. Packing and unpacking the labor bag 50 times. Cleaning the kitchen cupboards and organizing everything by size to the point that you make sure the silverware patterns match when it's stacked in the cutlery drawer. Sorting the baby's clothes over and over again is a favorite theme. Taking them out of the drawers and re-folding them, putting them away and doing it over and over again. Nesting will provide interesting stories for years to come. ....blah blah blah... One that you and your partner are sure to laugh about in the years to come...if he ever forgives you for sending him off to work and ripping down all the wallpaper in the hall! You may laugh about it now but you probably won't laugh when you're in the middle of it. No one can pull you out of it no matter how silly your behavior may seem. It simply becomes something that you must do! "

Star Trek: Lost Episode Transcript (What kind of site would this be without at least one Star Trek reference?) (Picard) "Mr. LaForge, have you had any success with your attempts at finding a weakness in the Borg? And Mr. Data, have you been able to access their command pathways?" (Geordi)"Yes, Captain. In fact, we found the answer by searching through our archives on late Twentieth-century computing technology." (Geordi presses a key, and a logo appears on the computer screen.) (Riker looks puzzled.) "What the hell is 'Microsoft'?" (Data turns to answer.) "Allow me to explain. We will send this program, for some reason called 'Windows', through the Borg command pathways. Once inside their root command unit, it will begin consuming system resources at an unstoppable rate." (Picard) "But the Borg have the ability to adapt. Won't they alter their processing systems to increase their storage capacity?" (Data) "Yes, Captain. But when 'Windows' detects this, it creates a new version of itself known as an 'upgrade'. The use of resources increases exponentially with each iteration. The Borg will not be able to adapt quickly enough. Eventually all of their processing ability will be taken over and none will be available for their normal operational functions." (Picard) "Excellent work. This is even better than that 'unsolvable geometric shape' idea." (Data) "Captain, We have successfully installed the 'Windows' in the command unit and as expected it immediately consumed 85% of all resources. We however have not received any confirmation of the expected 'upgrade'." (Geordi) "Our scanners have picked up an increase in Borg storage and CPU capacity to compensate, but we still have no indication of an 'upgrade' to compensate for their increase." (Picard) "Data, scan the history banks again and determine if their is something we have missed." (Data) "Sir, I believe their is a reason for the failure in the 'upgrade'. Apparently the Borg have circumvented that part of the plan by not sending in their registration cards. (Riker) "Captain we have no choice. Requesting permission to begin emergency escape sequence 3F . . ." (Geordi, excited) "Wait, Captain I just detected their CPU capacity has suddenly dropped to 0% !" (Picard) "Data, what does your scanners show?" (Data) "Apparently the Borg have found the internal 'Windows' module named 'Solitaire' and it has used up all the CPU capacity." (Picard) "Lets wait and see how long this 'solitaire' can reduce their functionality." (Riker) "Geordi what's the status on the Borg?" (Geordi) "As expected the Borg are attempting to re-engineer to compensate for increased CPU and storage demands, but each time they successfully increase resources I have setup our closest deep space monitor beacon to transmit more 'windows' modules from something called the 'Microsoft fun-pack'. (Picard) "How much time will that buy us ?" (Data) "Current Borg solution rates allow me to predicate an interest time span of 6 more hours." (Geordi) "Captain, another vessel has entered our sector." (Picard) "Identify." (Data) "It appears to have markings very similar to the 'Microsoft' logo" (Over the speakers) "THIS IS ADMIRAL BILL GATES OF THE MICROSOFT FLAGSHIP MONOPOLY. WE HAVE POSITIVE CONFIRMATION OF UNREGISTERED SOFTWARE IN THIS SECTOR. SURRENDER ALL ASSETS AND WE CAN AVOID ANY TROUBLE. YOU HAVE 10 SECONDS" (Data) "The alien ship has just opened its forward hatches and released thousands of humanoid shaped objects." (Picard) "Magnify forward viewer on the alien craft" (Riker) "Good God captain! Those are humans floating straight toward the Borg ship with no life support suits ! How can they survive the tortures of deep space ?!" (Data) "I don't believe that those are humans sir, if you will look closer I believe you will see that they are carrying something recognized by twenty-first century man as doe skin leather briefcases, and wearing Armani suits" (Riker and Picard together horrified) "Lawyers !!" (Geordi) "It can't be. All the Lawyers were rounded up and sent hurtling into the sun in 2017 during the Great Awakening." (Data) "True, but apparently some must have survived." (Riker) "They have surrounded the Borg ship and are covering it with all types of papers." (Data) "I believe that is known in ancient vernacular as 'red tape' - it often proves fatal." (Riker) "They're tearing the Borg to pieces !" (Picard) "Turn off the monitors. I can't stand to watch, not even the Borg deserve that."

good news. horray! i just got a call back from the doctor i am not so fond of. apparently the blood work came back very good and our progesterone level was a 21. she sounded happy about that and mentioned that she usually looks for a 15. horray. i have to admit, i like her a lot better when she's being posi. today is a vast improvement from yesterday. my hormones are still insane though. boy, do i prefer this extra happy mood over the hysterical crying i experienced last night. have i mentioned that i love chris more than anything in the world? i am so lucky to have him. sigh. "Progesterone is recognized as a vital female hormone central to successful conception and a healthy pregnancy. The word progesterone is itself etymologically related to the Latin root gestare - meaning to bear or carry - suggesting the importance of this hormone in creating a fertile environment for conception and the continuing development of the embryo. In short, progesterone is a female sex hormone that is secreted by the corpus luteum to prepare the endometrium for implantation of the fertilized egg. Following implantation, progesterone is then produced by the placenta during pregnancy to prevent rejection of the developing embryo or fetus. Therefore, progesterone plays a significant role in reproduction. Progesterone: -Helps create a fertile environment in the womb and promotes the survival of the fertilized egg through healthy implantation. -Strengthens and maintains the secretory endometrium which sustains the embryo throughout pregnancy. -Prevents the premature shedding of the secretory endometrium (menstruation)............" urlLink yay for the internet explaining things to me

today was difficult. more difficult than i was prepared for. chris and his mom took me to the obgyn for our first appointment. the whole experience started off on an uncomfortable note while we were in the waiting room. it ended with me being plain old miserable. chris and his mom were having yet another conversation about marriage. yeah, if there's one thing i hate it's when they talk about it as if i have no part in the decision. she's obviously trying to get him to marry me, or was. i know that. i also know that we love each other and it is bound to happen someday - but all of the passing discussion about it is making me feel like shit. at this point i don't even want to hear the word again unless he's actually asking me. and i don't even care when that is- or even if he never does. i'm just tired of feeling like our relationship is something he's being forced into, because it's not. i know that my hormones doing backflips. i know that a good part of the time i am being irrational. none of this changes the fact that the more this topic gets discussed in "passing", the more that i want to crawl into a ball and cry. i just want to say to everyone (my mom, sister, his mom): "hello! i'm right here. i can hear you talking. i am a human being and have (very irrational pregnant girl) feelings, ok? yes, i'd like to be his wife, but i am just as happy about how things are right now because we truly love each other and i have faith in that. the more you discuss it, the more you make me feel unwanted and that hurts. please stop." now, i would REALLY appreciate it if none of you used the M word for a while. between our moms i've had it. deal? (that means you too, sister) onto the next shitty event. i REALLY didn't like the doctor we went to. she was young,intelligent, and nice. she talked too fast. she didn't make an attempt to talk to me alone at all. she didn't look me in the eyes at all while she was speaking. worst of all, she scared me. and i felt very uncomfortable the entire time. so, i guess i'm going to do a little more research as far as the doctor thing goes. i chris wasn't there i would have walked out within the first five minutes. i'm glad he was there though. he makes me feel safe. i don't know what else to say really. i still feel overwhelmingly upset and afraid.

sorry about deleting the last entry. i just don't want to have to look at it and remember how that felt. today is a better day. i found a new doctor and spoke to my old one. I feel much better about everything now. as for the other stuff that was bothering me, oh well. i just need to develop thicker skin.
sorry for the lack of updates, but life has been hectic. i have a new blog with more up to date info. family and close friends can urlLink email me for a link. xo

I curled back up in bed for a few minutes this morning - after eating my whole wheat crakcers and drinking half of my milk - and... well, *basked* is really the only appropriate word, in the softness of our comforter snuggled up all around my ears. I don't climb back into bed often on workdays - mostly I'm late to the office because I never get out of it - but it was cold outside of our comforter, and it seemed like a good idea at the time. turns out it was. I had the first moment of something good I haven't felt in a long time, longer than I can remember. I'm not sure how exactly to describe the feeling. maybe a combination of contentment, happiness, optimism, peace - something warm and shining and pure that gleamed in my heart's eye like a pearl formed around a splinter of obsidian. I know I'm waxing goth-melodramatic here, and I hope that you will forgive me for it, but that's really what it felt like. I can still almost find that fleeting feeling of calm shining clean and white with all the colors of my emotions playing beneath its surface, but only if I don't try to grab onto it or stare too long at it. I'm better now, but only if I don't try too hard......
