Ear you go! It's never too late to start your Christmas shopping, and I have just the hot ticket for all you early birds out there who really do deserve the worm and whose family and friends only deserve the best. Check out these snappy little doodads, and at such a good price: This luxury item reminds me of the scene in one of my all-time favorite movies, Breakfast at Tiffany's, where Holly and Paul, with $10 burning in their pockets, dash to Tiffany's, and the salesman suggests a marvelous little sterling silver telephone dialer. Why use your own indelicate finger when a delicate implement designed exclusively for the activity is available at your fingertips? Indeed! Although cotton swabs (or Q-Tips, for those who enjoy using trademarked names as generics) serve the same purpose, you just don't get the same elegant effect from swabbing your ears as you do from scooping them (see the melon-baller-esque tip). And as everyone who's anyone knows, it's not just what you do, but how you do it.

why we liberals don't like guns, by Ken Mondschein "In the spirit of democracy, we present to you the following authoritative list of Why We Liberals Don't Like Guns. 1. We're Afraid of We liberals are vegetarians, and, like most herbivores, we are easily startled by loud noises caused by things like guns, pickup trucks, and Ted Nugent. This brings us to the fact that. . . 2. We Don't Hunt Tofu doesn't run away, and the biggest animals in my neighborhood are the subway rats. Besides which, since we believe so strongly in animal rights, it goes without saying that deer have as much right to live and be free and run for Congress as people do. Also, the thing about guns is that. . . 3. Bullets Come Out of Them And bullets can poke your eye out, which is what Mom always said what would happen if we played with BB guns. Speaking of which. . . 4. We Know About As Much About Them As We Do About Fixing a '56 Chevy Face it: Most liberals, being city-dwelling pansies, have never actually shot a firearm. (I have. Twice. Once was black powder, which involved the distinct possibility of blowing myself up.) However, even with my limited experience in shooting, I quickly discovered that. . . 5. We Liberals Are Really, Really Nearsighted and Clumsy Most liberals, including Yours Truly, wear really, really thick nerd glasses and are secretly afraid we'd be really lousy shots. Also. . . 6. Shooting Involves Being Outdoors We'd rather stay in and read Noam Chomsky and write letters to the Village Voice and work on our pasty complexions. However, no matter how liberal we are, one of the things about guns that scares us is. . . 7. We're Afraid Negroes Might Use Them Against Us As much as we may decry any and all racism, most liberals can't name, off the top of their head, the last time they actually hung out with a black person. The hypocrisy inherent in this issue is worth a whole story, except that I'd get branded a racist and no one would ever talk to me again. Also, it goes without saying that. . . 8. We Really Wish We Were European Because we heard that European women are easy. However, you're not allowed to have guns in Europe. Speaking of Europe. . . 9. We Are Trying To Make You All Into Homosexuals And that AR-15 just doesn't go with that handbag, girlfriend. Come to think of men in uniform. . . 10. We Haven't Had Any Really Good Wars Recently There are two wars we liberals really wish we'd been around for. The first is World War II, because, to judge by how we always compare everyone to Fascists, we would have loved to help defeat the Nazis (but not the Japanese, because, Pearl Harbor notwithstanding, they were the victims of racism). The second war we wish we'd been around for is Vietnam, but only to protest it, because nothing will ever again be as cool as the 1960s were. Also, we hear protesting the war got you laid. Which brings us to. . . 11. We Like to Legislate The liberal solution to a problem is to pass more laws. Only by constantly holding the threat of getting sued over everyone's head all the time can we create a just society. After all, people are inherently good and fair-minded, and that's why we need more laws to make them behave. Actually, the real reason that we legislate so much is. . . 12. We're Trying To Install A UN-Led Zionist Occupation Government We're Jewish, we're trying to take over, and only you and your .22 stand between us and complete world domination! In fact, the Jewish lust for power brings up another fear. . . 13. We're Secretly Afraid We Might Shoot Someone No! No! Bad thought! After all. . . 14. When I Was Just a Baby, My Momma Told Me, "Son, Always be a Good Boy, Don't Ever Play with Guns" But I shot a man in Reno, just to watch him die. Of course, it's obvious that the cause of gun crime isn't guns; it's the fact that we live in a society where the poorest people are crammed into crummy inner-city neighborhoods and people get so fed up with all the bureaucratic bullshit they flip out on bullet-shooting sprees. Take away the guns, and they'll probably just go on thumbtack-and-Bic-pen-stabbing sprees..." urlLink corporate mother fucker

RED WINE The positive and a few negative aspect of wine, and red wine in particular. Negative aspects Alcohol: high alcohol cunsumption results in a higher blood pressure and may cause hypertension. It has a positive correlation with mouth- throat- and gullet (med. oesophagus) cancer; under certain circumstances with liver cancer and liver cirrhosis. But what is "high" or "too much"? This defenition depends on the country you live in as well as you physiological condition. E.g. in the northern European countries, 2-3 glasses a day is considered more than enough, whereas the Mediterraneans think 5 glasses is still acceptable. Differences on a physiological basis: your body weight, dayly energy intake and the presence of ADH (= alcohol dehydrogenase, an enzyme in the stomach that degrades the alcohol before it can enter the blood stream). Tannin: these compounds are plant polyphenols and may cause headaches. Tannins tend to bind starches while being digested. These starches are needed by the body to produce serotonin. In some people, who are extremely sensitive to their serotonin levels, it appears the lack of serotonin can lead to a migraine. It sort of "starves" the body for this type of raw material, much as not eating for many hours might lead this person to have the same migraine. Tannin sensitivity is also now thought to be cumulative - a person who begins life with no tannin sensitivities may yet develop one as he or she ages. People who are sensitive to tannins need to moderate their intake of tannins in all forms, and also be sure to eat a reasonable amount of food while ingesting tannins, so the binding affects of tannins do not cause undue stress. But see also below at the positive aspects. Sulfites: some people are sensitive to it. That for the negative aspects, now the more favorable and pleasurable facts of red wine Positive aspects Reducing coronary heart diseases: the wine is altering the blood lipid levels. It lowers the total cholesterol count, and raises the high density lipoprotein (HDL) levels. This is supported by epidemiological studies: the polyphenols may be involved in this cardioprotective effect because of their antioxidant and free radical scavenging properties, resulting in decreased generation of oxidized lipids. The tested red wine extracts (cabernet-sauvignon grape variety) elicited enhanced NO generation, cyclic GMP accumulation and endothelium-dependent relaxation in rat aortic rings. Both anthocyanins and oligomeric condensed tannins appeared to be involved. Among the anthocyanins, delphinidin, but not malvidin or cyanidin, produced endothelial NO-dependent vasorelaxation (aka: it smooths the muscles of the blood vessels), indicating that only some specific structures are able to cause endothelium-dependent vasorelaxation, independently of their antioxidant properties. To achieve this effect, extracellular Ca2+ (=calcium ion) is needed for activation (of endothelial NO synthase activation). Summarizing: their findings suggest that one of the mechanisms of the cardioprotective effects of red wine and other plants containing polyphenols may be the increase in endothelial NO production induced by oligomeric condensed tannins and anthocyanins. Red wine maintains the immune system: According to a study published by the University of Florida, red wine does not supress the immune system like other alcoholic beverages. A two month study on mice has been performed to examine what immune system reactions red wine caused on mammals. The team examined mice of various drinking levels - non-drinkers, red wine drinkers, and heavy alcohol drinkers. They found that those who drank the red wine had a normal level of immunity, the same as that of the non-drinking mice. (The level of red wine consumption for the mice would equal that of a human drinking two or three glasses a night. But at the moment of writing (2001) they don't have a clue which compounds in red wine is causing this, but I'd go for the tannins. Polyphenols in wine: like the tannin mentioned above, do have a positive effect on your body as well: they are excellent antioxidants. In short: they lower total cholesterol and blood pressure, lessen risks of cancer, stimulate the immune system, and have anti-bacterial properties. See the above mentioned aspects for morte detail. Resveratrol (trans-3,5,4'-trihydroxystilbene): is a naturally occurring antioxidant too that decreases the stickiness of blood platelets and helps blood vessels remain open and flexible. It is said that it inhibits the enzymes that can stimulate cancer-cell growth and suppress immune response. A series of laboratory experiments suggests the proof of this statement. However, this was only tested on animals. In another set of animal tests, resveratrol was shown to inhibit both the acute and chronic phases of inflammation (yet again the immunbe system). Wine is the primary dietary source of resveratrol, and red wine contains much greater amounts of resveratrol than does white wine, since resveratrol is concentrated in the grape skin and the manufacturing process of red wine includes prolonged contact with grape skins. Resveratrol has been used in connection with atherosclerosis too (a reduced risk of course). Resveratrol is a phytoestrogen (= similar to estrogen, but from plant origin, and is known to inhibit tumors in the breast and uterus), but it differs from other phytoestrogens in that it acts as an estrogen agonist and stimulates ERE-driven reporter gene activity in CHO-K1 cells (I couldn't get access to ERE gen information, nor the exact description of CHO-K1 cells, but the context of the abstract implies increased DNA transcription activity of specific ERE-gene sequences in genetically modified(?) cells in rat uteri). A brief calculation: a glass of red wine provides approximately 640 mcg of resveratrol, while a handful of peanuts provides about 73 mcg. The amount used in animals to prevent cancer, however, would exceed 500 mg per human adult. This equals about 2.5 bottles of wine... So there must be at least one other component, or a mixture, that contributes to the decrease in occurence of cancer and high blood pressure prevention. Flavonoids: Red grapes contain flavonoids, also powerful antioxidants that work as cancer preventives. Anti-bacterial activity: In a study of 1800 people, scientists tested for the presence of Helicobacter pylori, which causes ulcer infections. Compared to non-drinkers, those who had one glass of wine a day had 7% fewer of these bacteria. Those who drink two glasses a day had 18%, and those who drank 3 or more glasses had 1/3 fewer bacteria. On the conto of tannins maybe? Anti-stress: wine does have a calming influence (surprise, surprise). The fact that a dinner is accompanied by a drink which helps the body relax and unwind can help the mental transition between work and relaxation. Also, people fighting other illness]s can combat them better when calm and focused. However, remains the question for the Health Board and researchers to clarify if red grape juice is as healthy as red wine. I'm not aware of published results that prove this hypothesis. During my college years some research has been carried out, of which the results show that the grape juice does have some positive effects, but not as profound as red wine. hihaa! Really, this is not just my selective memory speaking. During the preliminary research they didn't have the faintest idea for constructing a nice and plausible explanation for that, other then the scientifically correct description that goes something like this: "it is very likely a combination of well balanced different components and possibly environmental parameters acting together that influences the overall beneficial effect of red wine". Conclusion The net effect of drinking at least 2 to 3 glasses of wine a day is supposed to result in a healthier life. Besides my own knowledge, I used the following sources trying to get the results of the most recent research: http://www.pulsus.com/europe/05_01/stoc_ed.htm http://endo.edoc.com/end/v141n10/3657-abs-frame.html (is an abstract from Endocrinology, October 2000, Vol. 141, No. 10, pp. 3657-3667) http://wine.about.com/food/wine/library/encyc/bl_tannin.htm http://www.healthwell.com/healthnotes/Supp/Resveratrol.cfm

I want you. To want me. I WANT YOU TO WANT ME. I BEG YOU TO BEG ME. Sorry, it was on aol radio, and I like a Cheap Trick fix as much as anyone else. I'll stop it now. I love the way perspectives change as we age. For example: 5 years ago, I had no idea I'd be 24, even though I was 19 and I could do simple math. 24 might sound young to those of you in your thirties or forties, but it's not. 24 is, in my opinion, when one changes from puppy to full-grown dog. Attitudes change, relationships change. Life mutates into this strange entity called "reality", and I'm not sure if I like it very much. Alas, there is someone very close to me who will always be eleven years older: Chris the Boyfriend. Eleven years. Sounds like nothing to mature adults, right? I mean, I knew seventeen-year-old girls in high school who dated 32 year-old men. But I still remember when I was 11 years old--I was innocent. I played with legos. I played with Barbies. I had scads of Cabbage Patch Kids. I thought boys were icky. That same year, Chris was 22. He'd learned the special significance behind boobs; he listened to Metallica; he'd discovered the beauty of masturbation. He was banging chicks and going to shows. I was learning fractions and playing four-square. Chris and I started dating when I was 23 and he was 34 --quite a bragging right for a guy in his mid 30's. However, since the inception of our "relationship" (I hate that word), we've been playing this fun game. No, not the one with blindfolds and enemas. I call it "The Age Game". Simply put, he tells a story about his life B.J. (Before Jenna), and I proudly state how old I was at that time and what activities I enjoyed. For example, when Chris was graduating from high school, I was collecting my little ponys. He contemplated his future, and I began my long and illustrious career with illicit drugs. Wait. Bad example. Anyway, it goes something like that. Funny huh! In fact, let's play a little "Age Game" right now. Chris 1980: Chris was around twelve. He grew his first pube. Wondered what "white stuff" was like. (this is a guess because he can't even remember this far back, apparently) 1982: Chris was 14. He learned the importance of a blow job. Soon after he found out how much fun sex is. (thank you, whoever you are) 1984: Chris was 16. He learned how to drive. (legally) 1986: Chris was 18. He started college. 2003: Chris was 34. He meets Jenna and can't seem to get rid of her. Jenna 1980: Jenna was one. She wore a diaper and cried a lot. She was awfully cute, though. 1982: Jenna was three. She was pretty boring at this age and enjoyed sleeping and playing alone. 1984: Jenna was five. She impressed many family members with her ability to read Charlottes Web. She loved playing with her two year old sister more than anything. 1986: Jenna was seven. She started hating life, in general, and ignoring everyone around her. 2003: Jenna meets Chris and regains faith in the world. Her life is changed forever. I'm sure a totally futile and moronic game like this one is infuriating to him, but I think it will always be a joy for me. Why? Because I'm both sadistic and retarded. (And I need to feel as though it's OK to be much more immature and sensitive than him right now). Oh, and something's been bothering me lately (this is completely unrelated to the age game). I like to know everything. Everything. And as you all know, I have these great access and referral logs that allow me to know almost everything--mainly how you got here and where you're coming from. Yes, those are two different things. I've figured out almost every regular visitor to this site by these logs. Almost. The person who works for a company that starts with V and ends with R (to protect anonymity), who the hell are you? I have to admit, I'm stumped! At least give me a hint! JMEEISIS at yahoo dot com, I might even give you a tribute! Now, wouldn't that make your day? It wouldn't? Damnit. Oh well. Humor me. p.s. Puerto Rico was beautiful and amazing and impressive and terrifying. (just like everything else). i missed rick and my computer most. The highlight was DEFINATELY Chris and I having a penny throwing party in bed. (at each other). Such silly jews

I have a pretty major announcement to make today. Don't worry -- it's happy news, and as I prepare to embark on a lifetime commitment with the one I love, I want to share my happiness with you . I've decided to get married. To wine. What? Seriously. Every element of a love song -- the I love yous, the I can't live without yous, the you make my life completes and the wind beneath my wingses -- is how I feel about wine, and I've never felt it more profoundly than I do today. It's time for declare my enduring love for wine in front of God and the world. In other news, I need a nap that lasts until Christmasof 2005. Because zzzz. I seem to have descended into a vicious circle wherein I don't get enough sleep because I have so much to do, so I lie awake worrying about how much I have to do, and about not sleeping enough, and about how I'll never get it all done when I feel so tired, and on and on it goes. Eventually, I get sleepy, and then, just as I prepare to disembark from the train to the Land of Nodthe the dogs.. So, for some time, I lie awake, serenaded by the melodious sounds of bored panting and chewing, and I worry, and I wonder about things. I wonder why Jinx is chewing on on my sock. I wonder why I bother wondering about that, since Jinx will eat and/or play with anything that isn't nailed down, will eat and/or play with most nailed-down items as well, hates me, is crazy, is evil, is crazy-evil, and owes me ten socks. I wonder if it's true what they say about germs on feet. I wonder if I can catch a cold if Jinx gnaws on my sock and then drinks out of my wine glass. I wonder if the four year old sock I found (destroyed) the other day has germs on it from 1999. What if I get polio from that sock? Or tuberculosis? Or scurvy? I wonder if I should get up and wash my hands, although it's too late anyway and I obviously already have yellow fever and I shouldn't go to sleep at all since I'll wake up dead. I wonder where the expression "wake up dead" came from. I wonder if that "reeeee! ree ree!" noise it makes counts as yipping, or as squealing. One forty-oneone forty-twoone for-- shit, did I skip one thirty-nine? I think I skipped one thirty-nine. Do I count a howl as three yips or what? And how can nobody have stuffed a potato down that little fuckwad's throat by now? Shut UP, Yipsey Russell! You made me lose count! Wait. Oh. Crap, I've gone insane. Two twelvetwo thirteentwo fourteentwo fifteenI'm going to kill myselftwo seventeenoh, thank God. Aaaaand jinxed it. Nice one, Bunting. Crazy and stupid. Great. Two eighteentwo nineteentwo twentytwoahhhh. Hello, sleep. (FYI: all of the dogs are being silent right now. i'm just feeling silly.)

How To Keep A Healthy Level Of Insanity 1. At lunch time, sit in your parked car with sunglasses on and point a hair dryer at passing cars. See if they slow down. 2. Page yourself over the intercom. Don't disguise your voice. 3. Every time someone asks you to do something, ask if they want fries with that. 4. Put your garbage can on your desk and label it "in". 5. Put decaf in the coffee maker for 3 weeks. Once everyone has gotten over their caffeine addictions, switch to espresso. 6. In the memo field of all your checks, write "for sexual favors". 7. Finish all your sentences with "in accordance with the prophecy." 8. Don't use any punctuation marks 9. As often as possible, skip rather than walk. 10. Ask people what sex they are. Laugh hysterically after they answer. 11. Specify that your drive-through order is "to go". 12. Sing along at the opera. 13. Go to a poetry recital and ask why the poems don't rhyme. 14. Put mosquito netting around your work area. Play a tape of jungle sounds all day. 15. Five days in advance, tell your friends you can't attend their party because you're not in the mood. 16. Have your coworkers address you by your wrestling name, "Rock Hard Becky". 17. When the money comes out the ATM, scream "I won! I won! 3rd time this week!!!!!" 18. When leaving the zoo, start running towards the parking lot, yelling "Run for your lives, they're loose!!" 19. Tell your children over dinner, "Due to the economy, we're going to have to let one of you go."

Sadly, everything they say about pregnant women and cravings and the complete erosion of decency is absolutely true, and this evening I found myself standing utterly defenseless in the stop&shop buying all of the ingredients necessary to make my mom's famous meat loaf and mashed potatos. Honestly, that was the only thing I could have eaten at that moment, meat loaf made specifically the way my mom makes it, and I cant remember a better tasting meal in the last 10 years of my life. Another thing that has happened is all my clothes have started to fit differently, even though Im not much over my normal weight. I cant wear any of my jeans anymore, and even the comfy little pajama pants that used to hang on my hips are hugging my belly so tightly that I walk around like Ive got a corn cob stuck up my ass. (mmmm, corn on the cob) I definitely thought that the nausea would have begun to subside by this time, but the last two weeks have been by far the worst of the whole pregnancy. And there is no way to describe what this type of nausea feels like, just how torturous this sickness has been. And whenever people ask me, always expecting me to nod quickly in return, Dont you love being pregnant? I feel like I need to stand up for every woman who has thought to herself in dark moments that being pregnant is the worst lot in life and give them a lengthy, gory detail-ridden treatise on why in reality this whole process TOTALLY SUCKS, starting with what it tastes like to puke up chocolate pudding. But the other day, in those two or three seconds where I heard the baby's heart beat coming from my abdomen, I completely believed all the hype, that this never-ending nausea, this tightening of my favorite jeans around my expanding hips, this craving of all things greasy or fried, its all totally fucking worth it. Were having a baby.
merry christmas and chanukah and to everyone and stuff. love, me

Things in the Past Week That Have Brought Me to Uncontrollable Tears The finely orchestrated piece of crap otherwise known as the finale to Joe Millionaire. The look on jinx's face when I tripped over him coming out of the shower. The delicate beauty of a PB&J. The realization that Paris Hilton is someones daughter. Almost every sentence on every page of Under the Banner of Heaven, by Jon Krakauer. The fact i can't seem to stay awake longer than an hour at any given time. The fact that he is always awake to ask me if Im okay when I return from the bathroom. Not having enough bread to complete the recipe for a pb&j sandwich and being unable to make a pchocolate chip pb&j sandwich. Twelve consecutive hours of no bread in the house. Various segments on NBCs Today show specifically engineered to make people in my condition cry, all of them involving the triumph of the human spirit or massive amounts of weight loss. That one commercial where the guy is painting a wall in his living room and he accidentally backs up and knocks over the can of paint and it goes sprawling all over the wood floors and the Persian rug and he cant do anything but watch it splatter. That poor guy. Being unable to fit into most of my jeans. Remembering that when I was eight years old I thought I would grow up, have a baby girl and name her either Zoey or Emma. A spontaneous bout of heartburn that started over five days ago and has yet to subside. Seeing a man on television belly flop into a pool of water and thinking that he totally just hurt his baby. Thinking that there is no way a uterus could fit inside a body that can fit into Victorias Secret lingerie.

I know that if I actually gave birth to a baby who was wearing clothes when he came out of the womb that Id be quarantined and that theyd take him away and do all sorts of tests, but when I woke up from that dream I was honestly a little disappointed that it wasnt true. I mean, having a baby who not only comes equipped with his own clothes but is evolved enough to know how to match them,... now that is the type of baby I can get behind.

OK. SO, Now that the nausea has thoroughly subsided I am able to eat properly for two, and once Im done with two I feed the other 15 appetites that have seemingly taken up residence in my body. There are no words to describe the hunger I experience on a moment to moment basis, and not even white bread can satiate the urge to eat my own fingers. Not that I havent tried to curb the demons with white bread bagels, crumbly buttermilk biscuits, rolls, English muffins, and little dough balls made from strips of Wonder Bread that I roll up in the palm of my hand. Never before I have I been such an irresponsible adult, clogging my arteries hourly with enough carbohydrate voltage to power the United States. Im willing to bet that my boobs are just storage receptacles for excess white bread, and lets just say that Im well stocked for the long winter ahead. In addition to the boobation and hunger, the major second trimester side effects Im experiencing are aches and pains and cramps associated with the expansion of my uterus. If that sounds uncomfortable, you should try sleeping on your left side the ENTIRE NIGHT, five nights in a row as your thighs stretch and crack in opposite directions. Most of the books Ive read say that if I wake up in the middle of the night and I happen to be on my back, I should just roll over to my left side and not panic; however, sleeping on my back has the potential to suffocate the baby eventually and kill it dead in the uterus, SO BE CAREFUL AND GET USED TO IT! Im honestly afraid that if I happen to stop for more than a millisecond on my back as I turn from one side to the other that the Baby Police are going to come to my house and take me away in the back of a squad car for conspiracy to commit baby endangerment, and Id be totally guilty. Anyone with white bread boobs has to be guilty of something. now fuck off.

The past three months have been a creative nightmare here at Girl138 Headquarters, primarily because the parasite in my body has made it so that the definition of a good day is one in which I get up and actually wash my hair. Days when I actually take a shower or break out a tube of mascara are classified as really good, and on the rare occasion that I take a shower and wash my hair, I award myself gold stars of excellence. Now that Im feeling better and taking regular showers, I am hoping that Chris and I will be getting out of the house more, especially since he doesnt have to worry about taking me out in public with my hair caked in hormonal grease. For the past several weeks (when the house wasn't packed with extemely loud people) weve been sitting on our butts for hours on end, doing absolutely nothing. Ive decided that as a means of self-motivation Im going to try and publish a weekly set of photos that will include a status snaphot of my growing belly. (If you urlLink click here , you'll see the first of the batch) This may or may not work, and in a couple weeks I may abandon the whole idea because Im lazy like that. But I keep thinking that it would be fantastic at the end of this pregnancy to have a weekly collection of photos that shows me getting bigger and bigger and slower and slower on the stair case, if only to be able to show it to the baby when he/she is old enough to respond to guilt and manipulation.

Last night, while chris was having band practice, i got a phone call from my OBYGN. Apparently I had an abnormal pap result which they refer to as mild urlLink cervical dysplasia . Basically, i have pre cancerous cells on my cervix. I was hysterical. Chris had to cancel his practice and sit with me. I cried all night long and barely slept at all. I still have a migrane. I am really dissapointed to how my doctor's office handled breaking the news to me. When they called all that they told me was that I had a pre cancerous condition and I needed to schedule a biopsy. They didn't even tell me what it was called until I asked. That's it. They never told me anything about the negative HPV test or about how the condition is "mild" and has a very good chance of healing itself, until I called the office in hysterics today. (Not to mention it has a very good chance of being a false positive - since the HPV test came back negative (HPV is the usual cause) and I AM fucking pregnant). I don't trust doctors and I am not going to allow them to do any further testing until after I recover from having this baby, since I have read a lot in the last 24 hours saying that there is a very good chance that the condition will dissapear after the baby is born - and and that it's even more likely to happen if I follow a good diet and stay away from smokers. Even in the worst case scenario I still have plenty of time to let them go cutting my cervix into pieces. Apparently this condition takes up to 10 years to turn into anything cancerous, and "mild dysplasia" practically never turns into cancer anyway. Have I mentioned that most of the procedures they do to remove these cells are knows to cause premature birth, an incompetant cervix, and miscarriage? Some even destroy your ability to have children. I wonder if they think that I am unable to read. I'm following my gut on this. The biopsy and treatment (or lack there of) is just going to have to wait until after this baby is born, and there is no fucking way I am allowing them to convince me otherwise. After the baby I will have another pap .. and if there is no change THEN and only THEN will I allow this to proceed. Period. I am looking forward to going to the doctors office and introducing an idea to them that they have obviously never heard of before. It's called mother fucking bedside manner. I think that next time they want to scare the living shit out of someone, they should do it in their fucking office where the person can ask questions. Or here's an idea.. How about having the Doctor call the patient instead of some illiterate secretary. Was I supposed to wait for 9 days until my next appointment thinking that I was going to die or lose my baby? I wont forget to thank them for the the sleepless night and stress related migrane either.

I know that Ill probably have a little more insight into this when I finally give birth and am able to hold my own child in my arms, but right now, now as I can barely sit up straight without feeling the thump thump thump of my heart in my ears as it signals the march of acid through my digestive tract, as the smell of herbal shampoo in my hair urges me to hurl, as the mere thought of chicken wings conjures nightmares of being drowned in pools of rotting septic waste, I really have no idea how billions of women in the history of the world have not only gone through this once, but have agreed to go through it AGAIN AND AGAIN. Is there an epidemic of amnesia among mothers that no one talks about? I cant imagine that Ill forget anytime soon what it feels like to be nauseous in my fingers and toes. I can feel the dizziness in my eyebrows and in my elbows. Every joint in my body has gathered with signs and megaphones and is shouting in unison, THIS IS NOT WHAT NATURE INTENDED. And I really have to wonder, how did billions of years of evolution end up here, with pregnancy ushering in wholly debilitating nausea and a sense of smell normally reserved for canines? I mean, its 2004, for crying out loud. Humans now have the technology to PAUSE LIVE TELEVISION, why cant a woman who is pregnant wash her hands without dry-heaving stomach bile at the smell of Softsoap? HOW ARE THERE HUMAN BEINGS BORN IN THIS WORLD WHEN THERE IS SOFTSOAP SITTING ON BATHROOM COUNTERTOPS?

sometimes the only thing that can make a person feel better is having a friend to talk to. i am so lucky to have julie. just a few minutes of saying what's on my mind without fear of *rocking the boat* made a hell of a lot of difference. it even helped me to determine what i was (and was not) being rational about. now, i feel a hell of a lot better. not only because i got a lot off my chest - but also because i got to spend time with my friend. thanks julie. i love you.

How Your Baby Grows -- A monthly diary of your baby's development (MONTH FOUR) Your Baby The fetus moves, kicks, swallows, and can hear your voice. The skin is pink and transparent. Umbilical cord continues to grow and thicken to carry enough nourishment from mother to fetus -- but it also can pass along hazards like tobacco, alcohol and other drugs. Placenta is fully formed. By end of 4th month, fetus is 6 to 7 inches long and weighs about 5 ounces

finally feeling a little better, i think. not AS mad at the universe as before.. but i still have a lot of thinking to do. babies don't make life any less complicated, that's for sure. i guess that's part of the deal though. all i know is that i am not really upset anymore. i'm just in fix things before you hate everything in your life mode... on another note - i think i'm going out with julie tonight. hopefully we'll get some real food. that would be lovely. time to shower and stuff. i look like i was attacked by a lawn mower and (suprise) a bunch of chris's friends just walked into the house. bye.

This year has begun on the shittiest note ever. Actually, "fucking miserable" would be a more accurate description. New years eve was a disaster for me. I tried to stay in good spirits but it was impossible. I made a ton of food for the hundred or so people that were at our house, but within an hour or two i was so exhausted and sick that I had to hide in our room. That didn't help much though, since people were screaming and making enough noise to make a person deaf. Having to throw up every half hour didn't help much either, since there was a ten person line to get into the bathroom all night long. I wanted to kill myself.. but I just kept telling myself that it was only one night... and it would be over soon. Too bad that wasn't the case. Friday night some unknown person (i say that because everyone is pretending that they didn't know they were having another party) invited about thirty people over for another smoking, drinking, and being too loud to hear yourself thinking spree. I was even more sick than on New Years Eve. All I wante to do was go to sleep, but that was impossible with all of the noise. It would have been nice to be able to go downstairs and eat something.. because I was starving - but that was totally out of the question since the whole house had been transformed into a giant fucking ash tray. I tried to go to sleep so that I wouldn't cry - but it was no use. People kept walking into our room in an attemp to make me feel better or something. The only thing that got accomplished was that I was so upset I was unable to fall asleep until six in the morning. Saturday Chris invited another six or seven people to sleep over. They left this morning. SO it's sunday. All I wanted was one night to spend with Chris. One night that wasn't miserable or loud or filled with people. Fat chance. He just went to a show with Rick. I know that I am hormonal and easy to upset right now, btu in all honestly I feel like I shouldn't even be here. I am not sure that I want to be here anymore. It's too much chaos.. and it's no place for a pregnant woman. or a baby. I don't know what to do anymore. I feel so unimportant. (even worse, I feel like i'm ruining their fun). I wish my mom wasn't so far away. It's hard having nowhere to go when it gets like this. My body is so tired and I feel bad about myself and everything around me. I would give a million dollars to have just one person in my life to realize that I am not feeling like this for fun. There is a fucking PERSON growing inside of me and it is hard on my body and mind. Of course, that won't happen... because people are selfish and shitty by nature. I just wish that I had somewhere to go whre I didn't feel like a pain in the ass and I didn't have to be faced with the fact that no one gives a shit that the fact that I can't sleep and I am constantly surrounded by smoke all the time (especially in mass quantities) can and will hurt our baby. I might get an apartment around here... Just for that reason. I need somewhere to go when everyone is being an inconsiderate asshole. The only thing that scares me is that If I do get a place of my own- and things continue to be like this - I might never come home. (not than anyone would mind, i'm sure) Crappy New Year Everyone. Cheers.

yesterday i ordered cleatus's urlLink crib, dresser, armoir, changing table, and a glider . it's all about urlLink bellini baby . seriously, i don't know what i'd do if i didn't make a good amount of money. i have such expensive taste. this stuff cost me over $3700. thankully, everything turns into teen furniture - including the crib. the way i see it - the longer we can use all of this stuff, the better. in other news, i woke up on the wrong side if the bed today. i feel sad and alone, again.i can't wait for this baby to be born just so that i have something to do with myself again. ugh. i think i'm going to go shopping soon. i know it's shallow way to deal with life, but it helps.

i am going to be an "unmarried mother" and our baby will be considered "illegitimate". Ohhhhh yeahhhhhh - and my baby sister will be getting married before we will. Have i mentioned that she met her boyfriend after we found out I was pregnant. pretty cool, huh? ok, not really. i'm hormonal and i hate that I am going to be called a "single mother". I hate that our baby will be classified as "illegitimate". And even more so I absolutely HATE that Chris, Cleatus and I can't all have the same last name.. You know, like a real family ? That shit kills me. Especially since we love each other so much and (if I have anything to do with it) we will be together forever. It just seems like such a fucking waste to me. Yeah so, I brought it up today in conversation. This did not go over well. Basically, I tried to explain that no matter what happened - I was not going to have a different last name from this baby, even if it was only for a day. Chris didn't seem to like this idea too much. He said that I'm "causing the name problem" not "helping it" - because we "can" get married after the baby is born and then I can have the same last name as the two of them. I guess he doesn't realize that the name problem (as I see it) is the fact that we aren't going to be married when the baby is born, and therefor this baby will have a different last name from one of us for an unknown amount of time (he, of course, would like this person to be me). Sure, we could get married now and have the reception/party after the baby is born. The was the whole reason I wanted us to elope in the first place. We could get some time to spend alone before the baby is born. see some sunshine. have some fun. We could *make it official* somewhere that we would really enjoy - and then after the baby is born Chris could have the wedding party that he really wants. With everyone he wants to invite. I thought everyone would win. Yeah. Somehow that turned into bringing the entire "wedding party" on the trip. hehe. Oh man, I am not getting into this again. Yeah so, I'm crushed. dissapointed. sad. a little angry. etc. I think that not doing this is selfish on both our parts - but if this is how it has to be, SO BE IT. I'm just not going to be the lucky winner of the odd last name. Even if it is only for a short time. No thank you. I spend enough time feeling alienated. I'm having the same name as this baby. period. I won't back down, but i'll get over being upset about it. I always do. Anyway, I really shouldn't be allowed to read things like urlLink this in my pregnant state. So not helpful when I feel like this.

Taken from one of those pregnancy boards I mentioned the other day: "... Everything came back completely normal with the AFP test and everything is completely normal from the ultrasound.....the only sad thing was that I gained 6 pounds in one month! Wow! Anyone else with me?" I guess we all gotta find something to be despondent about. But...it gets even better. As I perused my way down the list of discussion threads on this particular pregnancy board, I came upon this title from another thread: "Is it appropriate to wear velvet pants?" I was captivated. Truly. I sat there for a good 2 - 3 minutes staring at that discussion thread title, debating on whether or not I should open and read some more. Never in my life had I weighed the moral nature of pants, be them velvet or otherwise. What the fuck could this woman possibly be talking about? Ultimately, I decided it would be best if I never found out. In other news, I went to see my OB today. Everything seems to be going well. My belly is measuring at 20cm (perfect).. the baby's heart beat is 155bpm (perfect) and my cervix is looking lovely as ever. Nothing abnormal going on for once. I am getting really excited about all of this. We're half way cooked! I can't wait to have this baby, but I really want him/her beamed out of me painlessly like on Star Trek... Our next U/S is on March 2nd - then Chris and I can go TINY PENIS/VAGINA HUNTING! How cool is that?

In less than two weeks Chris and I find out whether were having a boy or a girl. During the fist trimester I was convinced that I was having a boy, primarily because I only had dreams about boys and everyone around me had been insisting that it's a boy. Now that Im in my second trimester Im not so sure Im carrying a boy, and thats probably because Im feeling utterly overhwlemed with the urge to purchase little pink dresses, size 0-6 months. My feminist friends would be completely horrified to know this about me, that if I have a girl I will totally dress her like a girl. I know Im not supposed to impose my stringent, close-minded, privileged white bourgeois notion of gender roles onto my innocent child, but what baby girl in her right mind wouldnt want to show up to play group in urlLink this ? or urlLink these ?

The problem with depression, at least as i experience it, is that when i feel depressed i feel overwhelmed. Or maybe it's the other way, my depression occurs when i'm overwhelmed. That sort of makes more sense, i get why i'm overwhelmed, but i'm not sure why i would be depressed. Whichever it is, i still feel overwhelmed, which leads me to feeling useless and think that my attempt to do something - anything - is futile. What can i do to stop this? I can go somewhere quiet, try to think things out, and write some ideas out. That's what i could do. But instead, i'm trapped in this morning stillness - a stillness i usually love - with that burning question of what's the point? Why should i bother? i'm not a good girlfriend, i'm not going to be a good mother, i'm not doing that incredible job that i wanted to do. And yeah, okay, i know that isn't necessarily the truth. I know that i'm feeling overwhelmed/depressed and that's tainting my judgment. I totally get that. I know that it takes awhile to adjust to the ebb and flow of a new life and that i have plenty of time to find my footing. I love my life. I love Chris and I love this baby. I know, I know, I know, I know. I am very lucky. but this morning i still feel small and scared. hopefully writing it down will get it out of my system. hopefully...

So Im going to sit here and tell you what happened, and Im not going to take it back, and Im not going to hate myself in the morning. In fact, Im tired of hating myself in the morning and making excuses. Why are we constantly making excuses anyway? Why do we feel like we have to say, hey, I know Im going to hate myself in the morning, but I had a decision to make, so I made it? Why do we have to say, hey, I know its not cool to everyone if we do this, but just for this one instance, I dont care if its cool or not. Why do we have to be concerned with whether or not something is cool with everyone? And who the hell decided that formal weddings are cool? Was it the same person who decided that white lacy dresses are the thing to wear ? And why am I not ashamed that I dont want either? The point is, I was faced with a decision a little while ago. Have a quickly thrown together "wedding" without any input other than "tell me a few days before and I'll be there" from my husband-to-be OR ask him to just run away with me and "elope" to somewhere beautiful that we could have something that resembled a honeymoon. Although both had their down sides, I knew we couldn't have them both, so I had to choose one of them, and apparently I chose the SO NOT COOL one. I honestly don't know what happened .. but within three weeks this "elopement" morphed into something more disgusting than I ever could have imagined. Yes, a "formal wedding abroad". Sure. That's what I had in mind. A Wedding so far away that no one I love (including my own parents) could be there with me... and of course, all of his could. So, once again I get to be the alienated pregnant lady hiding in the bathroom because there's too much smoke at the table. Yeah. That's the perfect way for us to start our life together. Why don't we just go to a justice of the peace and then all out to Friday's! That will be NEAT! And I dont know, maybe I really am getting old, but Im starting not to care about what everyone thinks about it anymore. I thought this was supposed to be about us and ONLY us. And now, I am at the point that I'd rather do NOTHING than something forced and rushed and just thrown together in a hurry. that's what I was trying to avoid in the first place. Then I found myself searching for hotels that had casinos and golf courses and less expensive rooms so that Everyone could afford to go, SO THAT EVERYONE WOULD HAVE FUN, you know.. so I can be left alone in a hotel room. Then I find myself booking and unbooking dates because certain people have other plans. Then I finally get a date that "everyone" is free, and all of the resorts are booked. Ha! After the day I had today, I don't want to have to consider everyone else on the fucking planet ever again. I am not interested in what day person A is available and how muh person B can afford to spend. The way I see it we have approximately 4 and a half months of thinking about ourselves and our fucking relationship.. and we should fucking do that. We NEED to do that. What WE WANT is going to run far behind what's best for our baby after that. Call me selfish and UNCOOL. I don't fucking care. The next few months are not going to be about you. or you. or you. They are going to be about Chris. and I. And if that means we have to wait until we can get something together so that we will BOTH be happy, then that's what we're going to do. I refuse to make a sacrafice this time and I refuse for him to sacrafice anything either. And since we want completely different things out of this, the only answer I can think of is that we wait until we can plan something that will make us both happy. He can have his million friends and family around to watch and I can have it be something classy and romantic that involves at least some time for us to spend alone. TOGETHER. We are already making enough sacrafices, and that's that. And if anyone doesn't like it.. they can kiss my UNCOOL ass, because I really don't give a fuck about anyone besides him anymore. End of Rant/

(another thing I'm sure I won't want to be dealing with after the new arrival). 8. start a savings account for the baby. a rainy day fund, perhaps. 9. agree on baby names with Chris. This isn't going to be as easy as it sounds, i'm sure. 10. start shopping for baby items. -sublist- things the baby will need *at the hospital* Undershirt An outfit (such as a stretch suit, nightgown, or sweater set) A pair of socks or booties Receiving blanket Diapers and wipes Safety pins Infant car seat Diaper bag safety items for the house Night lights or soft lighting Baby monitor Baby nail/clippers/scissors manicure set things we'll need to transport the baby Car seat Stroller Backpacks and soft carriers Diaper bag things for the baby's room Crib, and crib linens Play pen, etc. Changing table Dresser glider or rocking chair Clothes hamper more stuff Diapers Receiving Blankets Clothing Bottles Pacifier thermometer Bathtub Washcloths Hooded Towels Diaper disposal system Burp Cloths and waterproof lap pads *sigh* i guess the reason god makes mom's to be "obsessed".. is that if they weren't the baby would be FUCKED. if i'm missing something, please urlLink let me know . thanks. xo

sometimes people say really stupid things. i am not going to get into this right now because i am angry... but let's just say that thinking before you speak would be an excellent habit to pick up right about now.

i am knowingly and happily marrying a man that has failed to mention the word "superbowl" all week, up to and including today. hmmm. ;) in other news, i am cleaning the house .. and broadcasting it via webcam. watch that belly scrub! you lucky viewers, you. awh yeah.

i am insane. i suddenly feel like writing because you are the only person that i have to talk to. (whoever you are) i don't know about what yet, but i'm sure this will lead somewhere. (ok, fine. i'm not sure. it probably won't. but that's never stopped me before..) there are a lot of things that are upsetting me. i know that i am being stupid and that i should be happy - but, i'm not. i am going crazy. i know it's partially hormonal - but i also know it's partially because i feel like we aren't ready, as a couple, to give this baby a happy home. i am a bit of a martyr, i guess. i always give up a lot in an attempt to make the people around me happy. i hate asking for things in return, but when i don't get the things that i consider to be important - i get very hurt and defensive. it's pathetic and wrong - especially since i never even ask for what i want. i simply expect the world to read my mind. hah. and that's what seems to be happening now. i gave up on the big things. i am beyond being upset about chris not setting aside a little time to take a last vacation with me. i am even beyond being crushed by the fact that we won't be able to get married (in a way that i think we deserve) before the baby is born (and probably never after that). so, now i just feel unimportant, unloveable, unstable, and afraid. the really sad part is that i didn't expect any of this. i love chris more than anything in the world. he is the only person in existance that has ever made me feel alive. he's the only person that i ever want to be with. i want to spend my life with him. i want to make sacrafices for him and more than anything else, i want to make him happy. most of the time i am miserable simply because i feel like i can't even do that anymore. before i was pregnant, i was able to handle so much more than this. i was so much more fun. i could have waited a million years for all of these things and been perfectly happy. and don't get wrong, just having him in my life does make me happy - and i know that should be enough. god, i really wish that it was. i wish that i didn't need him so much sometimes. i wish i could look in the mirror and say to myself "it's ok. if i have to, i can do this alone." even more so, i wish that what's going on didn't make me feel like i have to address doing this alone as an option at all. most of all, i wish that i understood why having a baby made me need him to make me feel protected, but suddenly it does. and it hurts. result: i shrug it off, i lose faith, and i feel like all the "unimportant things" that aren't progressing in some way are a part of the worldwide conspiracy to make me feel sad. at this point, i'd probably settle for some conversation about baby names. maybe some info as to when rick was going to vacate the baby's room so that I can get it carpeted and painted .. and schedule the baby furniture delivery. just a mention of it would do. of course, i'd also like to be able to have the wood floors fixed (they are so worn out that they give me splinters), but like everything else lately - i need help and a "date" to do that too. of course, i haven't officially asked him about any of these things . i am too afraid of saying things the wrong way and sounding as crazy as i feel. instead, i think i'll just wait around being miserable and hope that he finds his crystal ball before i give up hope in everything. god, all i want is for things to be ok again. i want to believe that they will be ok. i want to feel confident and happy in again, because i know that's the only way i'll ever be able to be a good mother and "girlfriend" (just saying that word makes me feel embarassed these days). i know this is all crazy and she won't know the difference for a long time.. but i will. i just feel like she deserves things like a pretty room to come home to and floors that wont hurt her when she starts to crawl. and yes, these things will make me feel better. and no, it's not the same as having a "legitimate family" - or some approval and acceptance from our own families - but it will do because it will make me feel better. it will make me feel like i'm doing something. then, maybe i won't have to pretend that something is the way it's supposed to be, because something will be. maybe i want to try to make up for the fact that i feel guilty for bringing this perfect little person into a completely imperfect situation. i don't know. i just want something to be right.. just one little thing. i guess i just want to feel like i've done something right for this baby - and right now i feel like i've done nothing at all.

long time no blog hmm. the baby is kicking me right now. she already wants out of my belly - i just know it. we got a urlLink new fridge yesterday and i love it. other than that there's not much to report. she tries, she fails welcome to my depression post. this morning i tried to convince chris to run away with me to vegas for the weekend. this is the last weekend that i am supposed to travel... so i figured it was worth a shot. sadly, chris said that he couldn't pull it together - so it's a no-go. i figured it was worth a shot, even though i knew he was going to say no before i even asked. somehow this conversation managed to spiral into a discussion that we should not have had. i'm not getting into it here, but i will say that i could not possibly feel any worse about things. all i wanted was to get away from here. just for a few days. i think it's something we really need to do (or at leastm i need to do) .. and now it's something we won't get to do for a really long time. i feel so alone and rejected. i feel like there is no one in the world i can talk to without being condemned. oh yeah, and everything is all my fault.

know how to piss off a pregnant woman? eat all of the american cheese. AGAIN. and don't replace it. this is the 10,000th time this has happened. you know, i am the ONLY person in this house that even bothers going to a grocery store. i don't eat that much stuff. i'm picky. but, i always buy EVERYONE food. cold cuts (i don't eat them), chips, assorted snacks, pasta, juice, milk, butter, toiletries, whatever. the only things i actually eat are american cheese, milk, and oatmeal cookies. this is no secret. YET - every time i am hungry.. there is nothing left that i can eat. i admit, i am upset about a lot of other things as well - but this is just fucking stupid. how hard is it to remember the words "you kill it, you fill it"? (PRETTY FUCKING HARD, APPARENTLY.) or even leave me a note... so i know to buy more. how about that? (OBVIOUSLY THAT'S ALSO TOO DIFFICULT) i feel like i'm in a college dorm (for entirely too many reasons) - and i don't like it. i am very hungry and now i want to cry. i hope everyone gets SARS today.

second, third, and fourth thoughts. yeah so, i was wrong about last night. chris didn't bring home 500 people , which is good. after last weekend... i really needed some rest from parties. however, he did just take the dogs to the park. it rained the last few days, which means that in about an hour he will return with two huge dogs covered in mud. i guess i shouldn't have bothered cleaning last night. i guess i really shouldn't bother cleaning, ever. it's practically worthless around here. i don't know how i am going to deal with this in the upcoming months. everything inside me is screaming for order and that's one thing we have none of around here. ever. it's killing me. in other news, the other day chris mentioned going to town hall to file for our marriage license this week. i never thought i'd say this, but i am not so sure that this is a good idea. urlLink from what i have read - the license is only good for 30 days... and he is busy practically the entire month. not to mention, we have absolutely no arrangements set. i am sad that so little thought went into this. we could have been flying out to the bahamas this week.. and had a beautiful ceremony and mini honeymoon. you know, some time together before the baby is born. that was so important to me. instead, it seems that he has opted to have a city hall thing.. no ceremony.. no honeymoon.. no nothing. in addition, he even suggested doing this "during the week" (so that it doesn't interfere with his schedule?). call me hormonal, but this does everything BUT make me happy. in fact, i am fighting the hormonal urge to scream at him about it. i am hurt and dissapointed. very dissapointed, in fact. this, of course, is all my fault. i made it clear to him that i did want to get married before the baby was born. i guess i forgot to mention that i wanted it to be special.. and fun... and i wanted us to have some private time together to celebrate. oh wait, i DID say that. i guess it just didn't matter. if i had somewhere to go, i'd be there. i don't know how to talk to him sometimes. especially when i am this upset. i don't want to say anything that i'll regret.. and right now that's just what i would do. the sad thing is - i have nowhere to go at all. the only thing i can think of that's more depressing than this - is going home to watch my father die and my mother go crazy. sometimes i wish that i was anyone but me.

why parties and pregnancy don't mix 10:00pm hungry kitchen is packed can't get in to find food nowhere to sit people are so loud floors are all wet don't know most of the people here bad headache bad mood 2:15am house full of loud people one bathroom me, in it, throwing up bathroom filled with wet towels & magazines people banging on the bathroom door screaming "jenna, i really have to pee" so, i get out. then the line forms. an hour later.. I'm vomiting in a towel in the bedroom - because the line is still there and because there's nowhere else to go. embarrassed. sick. aggrivated. upset. fall asleep alone. 9:00am wake up. alone. wash smelly towels. sweep. wipe counters. get clothes off the deck. mop floors. make coffee. 12:30 pm headache finally gone. thank god. sometimes this house is the only place in the world that can make me wish that I was at work.

22 weeks: it just keeps growing and growing and...

The baby has actually managed to wind me over the last couple of days by kicking me so hard. I especially like the well-placed kicks to the bladder. Eventually, I'm going to squirt pee when she does that...and then I'll have to make her pay, perhaps by dressing her like a clown for the first couple of years of school...ah ha ha ha... Okay, never mind. I'm just a little silly from lack of sleep. The mysterious pregnancy insomnia has officially started. It comes and goes, and I have no real control over it. Although, I confess, I sleep much better when i'm on the couch.. maybe I could move out, into some kind of tribal Women's Hut for the remaining 18 1/2 weeks and sleep on their couch. I don't think the dogs and the boy would understand though. Besides, can you imagine the mess I'd have to clean up when I moved back? Oy Vey. I better not leave. Anyhow, I think I'm getting the blues. Which sucks. Maybe it's just the waiting game of pregnancy, or maybe it's another hormone thing. I constantly feel unwanted, alone, or like I'm being criticized or attacked. Even my dreams have been sort of, well, depressing these last few days. I really wish we could take a vacation. Somewhere warm and exotic. Exotic meaning "Not Here", rather than exotic lady with a funny hat and pomegranates kind of way. I'm going to climb into bed with Chris now. I miss sleeping near him. He isn't feeling well so he is actually in bed for once. (Although, I'm sure once i get into bed he will get right out and I'll get to have another crying *i feel so unwanted* moment.) Sigh. Okay, time to snap out of it... Maybe I'll try writing again later, when I feel normal.

this baby is kicking my ass, i miss chris, and i can't sleep. GOD DAMNIT! its been less than a week since we discovered that were having a baby girl. and to be honest, i had been silently worried in the weeks headed up to the ultrasound. i hadnt felt any "real" movement in my abdomen, except for gas, indigestion and the occasional butterflies. most of the pregnant women i had talked to online said they had felt movement as early as the 15th week. i was starting my 21st week and terrified when the ultrasound technician began our session. what would she find? a festering alien pod? a gigantic lump of fatty deposits? Jimmy Hoffa? once the session got underway, however, i was immediately relieved to see the baby moving almost violently in the womb, and i soon discovered that every movement the baby had been making was probably being absorbed entirely by the placenta which was sitting on top of her. she did several flips while the technician tried to take her measurements, and every few minutes she would flash her foot at the screen, almost as if to say, have you seen my feet yet? im not sure youve seen my feet. here are my feet! and people, she has the cutest feet in the entire world. im pretty sure the technician performing the ultrasound permanently altered the position of the placenta because ever since our session ive been able to feel her move. and the sensation doesnt feel all fluttery anymore. no, when my baby girl moves its more of a BUMP and a THUD, as if she is kicking me has hard as her cute little feet can kick to say, pay attention to me, motherfucker. (contrary to popular opinion, i'm not going to use such language around my child, at least not intentionally, but i honestly think that the first word this baby utters will be that word or im constipated, just by virtue of being mine.)

That's right canadian friends. go check them out. i think they're playing with god forbid or something. go find them and congradulate the cutest daddy-to-be in the world. and buy their merch, haha. i think they'll be in both montreal & toronto on sunday. anyway, i managed to stay up until 11 or so - hanging out with the ever so drunk Rick last night. it was lovely. he always makes me laugh! today I think I'll do the grocery shopping, some laundry, and pick up a copy of urlLink what to expect the first year . I miss Chris already. He did the sweetest thing before he left and showered me with the most adorable hello kitty gifts a girl could ask for. I even got new hello kitty slippers, which I love. I don't ever want to take them off. As always, he makes me wish that I could fit in his pocket and go with him everywhere (but as he said: if i could, i'd just pee in it anyway). p.s. Julie. Come over. I miss you.
21 week photos. yay. i have stretch marks. ON MY BOOBS. (this is the part where I run away and puke)

Some things i'm noticing: The fear is starting. Right now, it's not even really fear, it's just, Oh my God, I'm having a baby! My life, Chris's life, will never be the same. Also, I'll eventually be someone's wife (i think). Lots to do. It's incredibly hard to focus on anything outside of organizing. But back to the baby. If you look and talk and ask, you get lots of feedback. I'm terrified of breast-feeding, and decided against it, but now am rethinking. Is that crazy? I'm not sure. Everyone I talk to about this is militant...about either doing it or not. I'd like a fresh, on-the-fence opinion. Aren't there any? I have so many concerns, and am afraid I will be SO uncomfortable that it will actually NOT be beneficial to the little one. Then as I was picking items for our registry, I worried: what if this is the wrong thing? Will it be too heavy for me? (I can't wait for the arm muscles I will inevitably develop come July) Will I cope? Is this item safe? I'm not even sure how to put a baby to sleep. How on earth is possible to wash the little one without hurting her? Cutting baby fingernails? I can barely cut my own! But wow, a mommy. This is a one way, no return, no refund trip. It's scary in that...and not at the same time. To have a needy little person around all the time is a bit off-putting, though, especially to someone who values her privacy as I do. And when am I going to write? Can barely write now, with all the work, distractions, and all the doctors' visits and so on. Still, I'm excited. I know this is right, this is the right thing, but can anyone get over the fear of walking straight off into the abyss of the unknown that is first-time parenthood? p.s. In response to all of the "what are you going to name her" emails: I don't know! Chris and I haven't really discussed it yet. I am hoping for the name I mentioned months ago (Julia Paige). It's the closest name I could find to Judy (Chris's Aunt) that I love. I figure we can also give her Judy's hebrew name to seal the deal. I also like Juliet and Jordana as first names- But, like I said - we haven't really discussed it yet. l'll keep you all posted as this progresses, i promise.

Things that i'm feeling thankful for right now: 1. Chris. I love him more than anything in this world. I am thankful that I met him, that I love him, and that I am lucky enough to share my life with him. 2. Cleatus. (or should I say Cleatoris?) This little alien has changed the way that I see practically everything. If my eyes are glass then she is windex. I love this baby more than any of you can imagine. Feeling her flutter makes my heart explode. 3. The Cleaning Lady. I think I love her too. She made the house look amazing today. It even smells pretty. What a lady. I'm the luckiest girl in the world.
It's a GIRL! My heart is about to explode. I am in love. more pics here: urlLink babygirl1.jpg - urlLink babygirl2.jpg - urlLink babygirl3.jpg - urlLink babygirl4.jpg

goodbye belly button. hello giant ass.

At 2:34am this morning I scurried blurry eyed into the bathroom for my nightly pee break, the first in what is usually three to four stumbling trips past bulky furniture and through menacing doorways that seem to grab my pinky toes every time I walk by. Ive grown to appreciate these nocturnal pee runs as they are the only time the baby isnt sitting directly on top of my bladder, and I can pee more than a half-thimble at a time. Id been warned that this would happen, that there would come a time in my pregnancy when I wouldnt be able to empty my bladder in one go. But no one ever told me it would happen this early, or that I wouldnt be able to empty my bladder in 15 goes. At 2:34am this morning I was seized with an almost paralyzing panic, a sickening realization that I am at that point in my pregnancy, just into my third trimester, the point when my body starts to become so unbearable that the lesser of two evils is actually going through labor. How terrible does life have to be that the actual process of childbirth is a preferable state of being? I honestly thought the The Belly would grow gradually enough that it would feel like a natural extension of my body, and this is perhaps the BIGGEST misconception I had about what it would be like to be pregnant. There is nothing natural about The Belly. It feels like an alien object has been implanted haphazardly into my abdomen, perhaps a basketball inflated with 20 lbs of loose gravel, and its constantly shifting its weight from organ to organ. For the first time in my life Im constantly aware that I have a gall bladder. Did I mention that this 20 lb basketball has legs and arms and an annoying habit of trying to get my attention EVERY SINGLE NIGHT at 11:30pm by poking her toes into my bladder? It was cute the first time, for the first 15 minutes. But two constant hours of twinkly toes has me concerned that shes got an acute case of Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder, or worse yet, that she takes after her father and is trying to rewire some recording equipment that she recently installed in the placenta. I know that her raging activity will slow down soon, that Ill miss the hourly thumping and nudging and bumping up against my spleen. But right now Im having a hard time concentrating on basic conversations, on simple activities like counting out change at the grocery store, on eking out the tiniest bit of pee after a full 10 minutes of sitting on the toilet with my leg behind my head, when all I want to do is yell out loud to my belly, in as diplomatic and non-threatening a way as possible, IN OUR FAMILY, WE DONT KICK PEOPLE LIKE THAT. And yet, how could I possibly expect her to take me seriously when we actually have thought about kicking people like that..

i have been slacking on the updates, i know. things have been ok. emotionally, i am feeling a little better. physically, i feel like i'm falling apart. i am so sore all the time.. and i feel like the ugliest person on the planet. however, i have been trying to stay in a better mood. i am not sure if that's working, but i'm trying. chris has been amazing about everything. he puts up with me when i don't even want to put up with me. i'm a lucky momma. as for the baby name game - we still have nothing. i can't think straight and nothing that has come up seems to work. it's upsetting - but i'm trying not to think about it. i don't want to feel sad anymore. well, i guess that's all. there is some other stuff i'd LOVE to talk about, but i don't want to jinx anything....

Julia Paige Jordana Elizabeth I am stuck on my original names. NOTHING else looks pretty to me anymore. especially when i am limited with a middle name like rose. here are the names i don't hate as much as everything else i have seen. sadly, none of them make me happy and none of them seem the least bit "right". Cassidy : gaelic, witty (sadly, i think she'll get teased in hebrew school for this one) Cecelia : latin - patron saint of music (I really want to like this one - but it's not happening) Celia : as you like it (same with this. I WANT it to work but it doesn't) Elizabeth : hebrew, loyal one (I love this, but ONLY as a middle name) Ella : light (here we go again with the god shit) Emilia : othello (can't use it - it reminds chris of his X) Emma : thoughtful (way too popular to use, although very pretty) Hazel : protected one (I love it but I'm afraid she won't like it someday) Jadyn : god has heard, hebrew (i love the sound. I love that it's hebrew.i hate the fact that it's "god" related) Jordana : intelligent, hebrew (my favorite. chris hates it) Jordyn : intelligent, hebrew (i probably only like this because it's similar to jordana - and i think jordana is much prettier BUT it doesn't make me miserable) Julia : the two gentlemen of verona (my other favorite. chris hates it) Katelynn : pure (it sounds pretty but It's too common ) Kelsey : victory (cute, but again - i't doesn't feel right) Miranda : the temptest (stupid sex in the city ruined this name for me) Nora : light, honor (i like this but i can't find one middle name that sounds pretty with it) Paige : helpful (another of my favorites. sadly, there isn't a middle name in existance that it works with. it's meant to BE a middle name, in my opinion) 5) if we don't come up with something soon i am going to become hysterical. i am less and less rational every day. i am uncomfortable. i'm having trouble sleeping. and i NEED to have this done. unfortuantely chris's suggestions have all made me ill. even some of the ones i have listed above as not hating are making me ill. i don't know what we're going to do. seriously. pregnancy sucks.

I've reached a point where, unlike the first six or so months of my pregnancy, I am now consistently cognizant of being pregnant. Up until recently, there were times when I could "forget" I was pregnant for a little while -- by that, I mean that I could get busy with work, something social, or even housework -- but now that has changed. My body has completely changed in how it feels from the inside and how it looks from the outside. I'm fucking uncomfortable, and I still have the worst to go. My stomach is hard and big, my hips and pelvis feel like they are about to snap or shatter, leaving me with a giant sac of organs and baby balancing on nothing but two femurs, like an overfilled water-balloon on two toothpicks. I pee all the time. I feel like I have to pee again as I'm washing my hands from the last pee that I took. I can barely turn over in my sleep. I can rarely get up from a reclining position without help. I can't bend over to pick things up, so I'm at the mercy of the people around me to pick things up, including me, or to flip me over every once and a while, like a giant beef paddy, so my hips don't disintegrate. Then there's the hormones. I'm usually fairly balanced (laugh if you must, but it was once true). I've never been the type to cry at long distance commercials, "awwww" at the sight of Hallmark cards with little kittens on the front, or collect Anne Geddes posters. At this point in my pregnancy, there remains only a shadow of the (relatively) emotionally stable person I once was. I cry when I can't get up. I cry when I face even the most minor of conflicts. I cry at cheesy after-school special type moments in movies or tv shows. I cry when I can't bend over to pick up my laundry. I cry because my hips and pelvis hurt and there's nothing I can do about it. I cry because I can't fucking turn over in my sleep without an immense amount of pain, and sometimes even then I can't turn over. I cry because I can't catch up with my work because my brain is fucking mushy and I don't know if I'll ever be smart and sharp again. I cry a lot about that one. Mostly, I cry because there is so fucking much to do and the clincher is, I just can not pick up the slack. I'm physically and/or mentally unable to. This is the most frustrating thing ever. I guess I hide it well too, because it seems like many of the people around me (not all of you) just don't comprehend how useless I am. This is why I cry the most.

today was a special day. not only did i get my wonderful husband to take me shoe shopping (i NEVER thought that day would come, haha) but - we also had jordana's first doctor appointment. She is doing well. She gained a little weigt and grew a little height wise. She is completely "normal" as far as all of that goes. I never imagined that a child of mine would be called "normal". haha. I won't get to used to that, promise. Anyway, at the doctors office we discovered that she has a little infection in her cord. it was bleeding red when the doctor pulled on it.. and she started crying. then, the doctor did something to help it heal and I started crying louder than Jordana. Seeing her in pain nearly broke me into a thousand bits. Who knew it was possible to love anything so much. My heart hurts when she cries.

I can't believe that it's already been a week. Things are going well. (better than I expected). I LOVE being a mommy. When I look at her I can't help but wish that I was able to be one of those "stay at home moms" forever.. just so I'd never miss one of her gassy smiles or baby farts. Just thinking about being away from her for more than five minutes breaks my heart. I am going to have some tough weeks ahead with this weaning myself back to work thing.. that's for sure. On another note - Chris has been amazing. He's a natural at this daddy stuff. And it's so funny how much alike the two of them are. I can already see traits of his shining through her. It makes me want to explode. I feel so fucking lucky. Very tired, but lucky. last night i lost my mucous plug. gross? well, you should have seen the "bloody show" this morning then. Labor Signs... You pass your mucus plug, the small amount of thickened mucus that blocks the cervical canal leading to the uterus. You might actually see a clump of mucus in the toilet or in your underwear, or you might just notice an increase in mucus discharge. Sometimes the mucus is tinged with a tiny bit of brownish, pink, or red blood when it's expelled. This is called bloody show. If labor hasn't started already at this point, it usually starts within a day or two after you see a clump of mucus or bloody show. However, having sex or a vaginal exam can also disturb the mucus plug and cause you to see some bloody show even when labor isn't about to start. anyhow, yesterday the baby furniture arrived. it looks adorable. i am having one lucky baby. ;) ( urlLink more pics )

yesterday was jordana's one month unbirthday. it's simply amazing how time flies. in all honesty i can't remember what life was like without her. it's just plain wierd. she has accomplished so much in her one month of life. she got a social security card, learned how to turn over, smile, kick off her blankets, smack her parents (and herself) in the nose, and she has developed an appeciation for music. she loves baby einstein cds. they make her so happy. she still hardly ever cries. once in a blue moon she lets out a "whaaa" but it always equated to "change my diaper mommy" or "feed me damn it". other than that she's all googlie eyes and silly faces. i melt when i look at her. she has never used a pacifier or a "bouncy seat" or slept in her crib. although we have all of these things readily on hand she's never needed them. she's entertained by simple things ... like staring at the ceiling, paintings, and sleeping with her parents. she is such a happy baby. we are so lucky. we really are. as for me, i think i'm getting the hang of this mommy thing. i can tell you one thing - I LOVE doing it. this week i went into the office a few times in the mornings and then worked from home the rest of the day. every single day i cried hysterically. i hate being away from her regardless of for how long. I would do anything to be able to stay home with her all the time and it kills me that i don't have that option. in that respect, this has been the hardest week of my life. luckily, it's impossible to get too depressed when you have a family as wonderful as mine to come home to. well, that's all for now. jordana is taking a nap and i have some work to do. chris is leaving for the UK in a few days and jordana and i will be spending that time at my mom's house, so i also have to pack. it's going to suck not having him around. *sniffle*
